  9585 00000350 A820                    		test	al, 20h		; test data set	ready
  9586 00000352 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  9587 00000354 F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
  9588 00000357 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  9589                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9590                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
  9591                                  		;clc
  9592 00000359 C3                      		retn
  9593                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9594                                  
  9595                                  ;************************************************************************
  9596                                  ;*									*
  9597                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
  9598                                  ;*									*
  9599                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  9600                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  9601                                  ;*									*
  9602                                  ;************************************************************************
  9603                                  
  9604                                  auxstat:				
  9605 0000035A B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  9606                                  
  9607                                  		; fall into auxop
  9608                                  
  9609                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9610                                  
  9611                                  ;************************************************************************
  9612                                  ;*									*
  9613                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  9614                                  ;*									*
  9615                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  9616                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  9617                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  9618                                  ;*									*
  9619                                  ;************************************************************************
  9620                                  
  9621                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  9622 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  9623                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  9624                                  					; get port number
  9625 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  9626                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  9627                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  9628 00000362 C3                      		retn
  9629                                  
  9630                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9631                                  
  9632                                  ;************************************************************************
  9633                                  ;*									*
  9634                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  9635                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  9636                                  ;*									*
  9637                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  9638                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  9639                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  9640                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  9641                                  ;*									*
  9642                                  ;************************************************************************
  9643                                  
  9644                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  9645 00000363 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  9646 00000366 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  9647                                  					; zero out buffer
  9648                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  9649                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9650                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  9651 00000369 C3                      		retn
  9652                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9653                                  
  9654                                  ;************************************************************************
  9655                                  ;*									*
  9656                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  9657                                  ;*									*
  9658                                  ;************************************************************************
  9659                                  
  9660                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  9661                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  9662 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  9663                                  aux_loop:				
  9664 0000036C 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  9665                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  9666 0000036F 47                      		inc	di
  9667 00000370 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  9668 00000372 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  9669 00000375 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  9670 00000378 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  9671 0000037A B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  9672 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  9673                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9674                                  
  9675                                  awok:					
  9676 0000037F E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  9677                                  					; still	more character to print
  9678                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  9679                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9680                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  9681 00000381 C3                      		retn
  9682                                  
  9683                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9684                                  
  9685                                  ;************************************************************************
  9686                                  ;*									*
  9687                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  9688                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  9689                                  ;*									*
  9690                                  ;************************************************************************
  9691                                  
  9692                                  getbx:	
  9693 00000382 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  9694                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  9695                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  9696 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  9697                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9698                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  9699 0000038A C3                      		retn
  9700                                  
  9701                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9702                                  
  9703                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9704                                  
  9705                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9706                                  ;								:
  9707                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  9708                                  ;								:
  9709                                  ;								:
  9710                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  9711                                  ;								:
  9712                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9713                                  ;								:
  9714                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9715                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9716                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9717                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9718                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9719                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9720                                  ;								:
  9721                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9722                                  ;								:
  9723                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9724                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9725                                  ;								:
  9726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9727                                  
  9728                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9729                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9730                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9731                                  
  9732                                  ;19/07/2019
  9733                                  ;09/03/2019
  9734                                  
  9735                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9736                                  
  9737                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9738                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9739                                  
  9740 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9741 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9742 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9743 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9744 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9745 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9746 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9747 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9748 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9749 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9750 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9751 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9752 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9753 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9754 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9755                                  
  9756                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9757                                  
  9758 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9759 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9760 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9761 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9762 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9763 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9764 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9765 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9766 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9767 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9768 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9769 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9770 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9771 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9772 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9773 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9774 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9775 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9776 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9777 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9778                                  
  9779                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9780                                  
  9781                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9782                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9783                                  
  9784                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9785                                  ;
  9786                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9787                                  ;
  9788                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9789                                  ;
  9790                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9791                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9792                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9793                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9794                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9795                                  ;
  9796                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9797                                  ;
  9798                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9799                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9800                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9801                                  ;
  9802                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9803                                  
  9804                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9805 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9806 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9807                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9808 000003D4 803E[EC04]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9809                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9810 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9811 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9812                                  					; get binary hours
  9813                                  					; convert to bcd
  9814 000003DF FF1E[FB04]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9815                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9816 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9817 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9818 000003E9 FF1E[FB04]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9819                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9820 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9821 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9822 000003F3 FF1E[FB04]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9823                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9824 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9825 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9826 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9827 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9828 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9829                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9830                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9831                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9832 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9833                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9834 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9835 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9836                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9837 00000409 FF1E[D906]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9838                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9839                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9840                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9841 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9842 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9843 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9844                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9845                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9846                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9847 00000412 8F06[E904]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9848 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9849                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9850 00000417 803E[EC04]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9851 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9852 0000041E FF1E[FF04]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9853                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9854                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9855 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9856 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9857 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9858                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9859                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9860                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9861 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9862                                  no_cmos_2:
  9863                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9864                                  		; cf=0				
  9865                                  		;clc
  9866 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9867                                  
  9868                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9869                                  
  9870                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9871                                  
  9872                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9873                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9874                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9875                                  ;
  9876                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9877                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9878                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9879                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9880                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9881                                  ;
  9882                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9883                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9884                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9885                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9886                                  
  9887                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9888                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (& Retro DOS v4.1 optimization)
  9889                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04EFh)
  9890                                  
  9891                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9892 00000429 E84A00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9893 0000042C 8B36[E904]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9894                                  
  9895                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9896                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9897                                  ;
  9898                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9899                                  ;	       ----------------
  9900                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9901                                  ;
  9902                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9903                                  ;
  9904                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9905                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9906                                  ;		1,193,180
  9907                                  ;
  9908                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9909                                  ;
  9910                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9911                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9912                                  ;		59,659
  9913                                  ;
  9914                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9915                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9916                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9917                                  ;
  9918                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9919                                  ; multiply by 5
  9920                                  
  9921 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9922 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9923                                  					; multiply by 5
  9924 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9925 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9926 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9927 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9928 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9929 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9930 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9931                                  
  9932                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9933                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9934                                  
  9935 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9936 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9937                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9938                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9939                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9940 00000446 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  9941 00000447 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9942 00000449 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9943                                  
  9944                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9945                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9946                                  
  9947 0000044B 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9948 0000044D B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9949                                  
  9950                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9951                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9952                                  
  9953 00000450 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9954 00000452 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9955 00000455 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9956 00000457 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9957                                  noadj:					
  9958 0000045A F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9959 0000045B 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9960                                  
  9961                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9962                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9963                                  
  9964 0000045D D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9965 0000045F B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9966 00000461 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9967                                  		;mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9968                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9969 00000463 B13C                    		mov	cl, 60
  9970 00000465 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9971 00000467 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9972 00000469 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9973 0000046B 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9974                                  
  9975                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9976                                  
  9977                                  		; 20/12/2023
  9978                                  		;push	ax
  9979                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9980 0000046D 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9981 0000046E AB                      		stosw
  9982                                  		;pop	ax
  9983 0000046F 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9984 00000470 AB                      		stosw
  9985 00000471 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9986 00000473 AB                      		stosw
  9987 00000474 F8                      		clc
  9988 00000475 C3                      		retn
  9989                                  
  9990                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9991                                  
  9992                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9993                                  
  9994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9995                                  ;
  9996                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9997                                  ;
  9998                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9999                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
 10000                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
 10001                                  ;
 10002                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
 10003                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
 10004                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
 10005                                  ;			else
 10006                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
 10007                                  ;		}
 10008                                  ;
 10009                                  ; USES : AX
 10010                                  ;
 10011                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
 10012                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
 10013                                  ;
 10014                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10015                                  
 10016                                  		; 17/10/2022
 10017                                  GetTickCnt:	
 10018 00000476 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 10019 00000478 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
 10020                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
 10021                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
 10022                                  					; midnight
 10023                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
 10024                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10025 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 10026 0000047C 3826[EB04]              		cmp	byte [t_switch], ah ; 0
 10027                                  		;cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
 10028 00000480 7505                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
 10029                                  		;xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
 10030                                  					; and not flag
 10031 00000482 0106[E904]              		add	[daycnt], ax
 10032 00000486 C3                      		retn
 10033                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10034                                  
 10035                                  inc_case:				
 10036 00000487 08C0                    		or	al, al
 10037 00000489 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
 10038 0000048B FF06[E904]              		inc	word [daycnt]
 10039                                  no_rollover:				
 10040 0000048F C3                      		retn
 10041

 10043                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 10044                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 10046                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10047                                  
 10048                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 3.3 - 02/02/1988
 10049                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 10050                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0

 10072                                  
 10073                                  ; device attribute bits:
 10074                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
 10075                                  
 10076                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
 10077                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
 10078                                  
 10079                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
 10080                                  
 10081                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
 10082                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
 10083                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
 10084                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
 10085                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
 10086                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
 10087                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
 10088                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
 10089                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
 10090                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
 10091                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
 10092                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
 10093                                  ; we reset the counter.
 10094                                  
 10095                                  accessmax	equ	5
 10096                                  
 10097                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
 10098                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
 10099                                  ;
 10100                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
 10101                                  ;   if it is 0, then
 10102                                  ;	set slow = 15
 10103                                  ;   else
 10104                                  ;	set slow = value
 10105                                  ;   ...
 10106                                  ;*********************************************
 10107                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
 10108                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
 10109                                  ;*	 use slow
 10110                                  ;*   else
 10111                                  ;*	 use fast
 10112                                  ;*********************************************
 10113                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
 10114                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
 10115                                  ;	use slow
 10116                                  ;   else
 10117                                  ;	use fast
 10118                                  ;   ...
 10119                                  ;   restore current head settle value
 10120                                  ;
 10121                                  ;
 10122                                  ;---------------------------------------
 10123                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
 10124                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
 10125                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
 10126                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
 10127                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
 10128                                  
 10129                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
 10130                                  
 10131                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10132                                  
 10133                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)

 10207                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

 10209                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10210                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
 10211                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
 10212                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
 10213                                  ;
 10214                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
 10215                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10216                                  
 10217                                  SetDrive:	
 10218                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
 10219 000004C6 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
 10220                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
 10221 000004CA 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
 10222 000004CE 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
 10223 000004D0 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
 10224 000004D3 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 10225 000004D6 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
 10226 000004D8 F9                      		stc
 10227                                  X_SetDrv:				
 10228 000004D9 C3                      		retn
 10229                                  
 10230                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10231                                  
 10232                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10233                                  
 10234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 10235                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
 10236                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
 10237                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
 10238                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
 10239                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 10240                                  
 10241                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
 10242 000004DA E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
 10243 000004DD BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
 10244 000004E0 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10245                                  					; fchanged_by_format
 10246 000004E5 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
 10247                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10248 000004E7 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
 10249                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10250                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
 10251 000004EC C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
 10252                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
 10253 000004F1 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10254                                  					; fnon_removable
 10255 000004F6 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
 10256 000004F8 BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
 10257 000004FB EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
 10258                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10259                                  
 10260                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
 10261                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
 10262 000004FD 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10263 00000502 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 10264                                  wehaveafloppy:				
 10265 00000504 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
 10266                                  
 10267                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
 10268                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
 10269                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
 10270                                  
 10271 00000506 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
 10272 0000050B 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
 10273 0000050D E85212                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
 10274 00000510 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
 10275 00000512 E8A213                  		call	haschange
 10276 00000515 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 10277                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
 10278                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
 10279                                  			
 10280 00000517 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
 10281 0000051A A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
 10282 0000051D 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10283                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
 10284 00000521 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
 10285 00000523 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
 10286 00000526 EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done

 10288                                  
 10289                                  Media_Unk:

 10291                                  
 10292                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
 10293                                  		; Clean up the left overs
 10294                                  Media_Done:	
 10295                                  		; 19/10/2022			
 10296 00000529 06                      		push	es
 10297 0000052A C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
 10298 0000052E 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
 10299 00000532 07                      		pop	es
 10300 00000533 09F6                    		or	si, si
 10301 00000535 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
 10302 00000537 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 10303 0000053C 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
 10304 0000053E E80813                  		call	media_set_vid
 10305                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:			
 10306 00000541 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
 10307                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
 10308                                  ret_carry_clear:			
 10309 00000546 F8                      		clc			; volidok
 10310 00000547 C3                      		retn
 10311                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10312                                  
 10313                                  err_exitj:				
 10314 00000548 E86806                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
 10315                                  ret81:					
 10316 0000054B B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
 10317 0000054D C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
 10318                                  
 10319                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10320                                  
 10321                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10322                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 10323                                  ; drive.
 10324                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 10325                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 10326                                  ; returns in si:
 10327                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10328                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10329                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10330                                  ;
 10331                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10332                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10333                                  
 10334                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10335                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10336 0000054E BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10337 00000551 E822FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10338 00000554 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10339                                  					; get stored time
 10340 00000558 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10341 0000055A 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10342 0000055E 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10343 00000560 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10344 00000562 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10345 00000564 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10346 00000566 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10347 0000056A 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10348                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok

 10350 00000571 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap

 10416                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
 10417                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
 10418                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
 10419                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data.

 10421                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are

 10440                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10441                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10442                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10443                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10444                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10445                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10446                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10447                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 10448                                  ;
 10449                                  ;	trashes si, cx
 10450                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10451                                  
 10452                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 10453                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8

 10456                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)

 10462 000005CE 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10463 000005D2 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]

 10466                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
 10467                                  		; merging them... jgl

 10473                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
 10474 000005D8 BE[1605]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022

 10476 000005DE F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10477                                  		
 10478                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10479                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10480                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10481                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10482                                  
 10483                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10484                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10485                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10486                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10487                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10488                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10489                                  			;
 10490                                  			; Correct Code:
 10491                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10492                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10493                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10494                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10495                                  			;
 10496                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10497                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10498                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10499                                  			;
 10500                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10501                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10502                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10503                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10504                                  
 10505 000005E0 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10506                                  		
 10507                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"

 10511 000005E7 BE[0405]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	; 19/10/2022

 10514                                  		; 10/12/2022

 10527                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10528                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10529                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10530                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10531                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10532                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10533                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10534                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10535                                  ;
 10536                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10537                                  ;
 10538                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10539                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10540                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10541                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10542                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10543                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10544                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10545                                  ;
 10546                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10547                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10548                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10549                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10550                                  
 10551                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.

 10555                                  		;jmp	getret_exit
