 14245                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14246                                  
 14247                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14248                                  
 14249                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14250                                  ;
 14251                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14252                                  ;
 14253                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14254                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14255                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14256                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14257                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14258                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14259                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14260                                  ;
 14261                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14262                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14263                                  ;
 14264                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14265                                  
 14266                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14267                                  HMAPtr:
 14268 00001374 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14269                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14270 00001379 8B3E[EB08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14271                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14272 0000137D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14273 00001380 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14274 00001382 803E[F108]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14275                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14276 00001387 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14277 00001389 FF1E[ED08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14278                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14279 0000138D 8B3E[EB08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14280                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14281                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14282 00001391 C3                      		retn
 14283                                  
 14284                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14285                                  
 14286                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14287                                  
 14288                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14289                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14290                                  
 14291                                  move_sector:
 14292                                  
 14293                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14294                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14295                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14296                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14297                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14298                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14299                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14300                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14301                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14302                                  ;
 14303                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14304                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14305                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14306                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14307                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14308                                  
 14309 00001392 FC                      		cld
 14310 00001393 51                      		push	cx
 14311 00001394 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14312 00001397 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14313 0000139B 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14314 0000139D 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14315 000013A1 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14316 000013A3 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14317 000013A5 59                      		pop	cx
 14318 000013A6 C3                      		retn
 14319                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14320                                  
 14321                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14322 000013A7 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14323 000013A9 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14324 000013AB 59                      		pop	cx
 14325 000013AC C3                      		retn
 14326                                  
 14327                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14328                                  
 14329                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14330                                  
 14331                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14332                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14333                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14334                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14335                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14336                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14337                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14338                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14339                                  ;
 14340                                  ; input conditions:
 14341                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14342                                  ;
 14343                                  ; output:
 14344                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14345                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14346                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14347                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14348                                  
 14349                                  check_wrap:	
 14350 000013AD 50                      		push	ax
 14351 000013AE 53                      		push	bx
 14352 000013AF 06                      		push	es
 14353 000013B0 57                      		push	di
 14354 000013B1 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14355 000013B4 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14356                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14357 000013B6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14358                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14359 000013BB 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14360 000013BD 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14361 000013C1 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14362 000013C3 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14363 000013C6 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14364 000013C8 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14365 000013CA F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14366                                  
 14367                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14368                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14369                                  
 14370 000013CC 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14371 000013CE 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14372                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14373 000013D0 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14374 000013D1 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14375                                  					; if on	boundary
 14376                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14377                                  not_on_bound:				
 14378 000013D3 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14379 000013D6 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14380 000013D8 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14381 000013DA 40                      		inc	ax
 14382 000013DB 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14383 000013DD 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14384                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14385 000013E0 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14386 000013E4 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14387                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14388                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14389 000013E6 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14390 000013E8 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14391 000013E9 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14392                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14393 000013EB F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14394                                  
 14395                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14396                                  
 14397 000013ED 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14398 000013EF 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14399 000013F1 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14400                                  
 14401                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14402                                  
 14403 000013F3 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14404 000013F5 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14405 000013F7 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14406                                  no_head_bound:				
 14407 000013F8 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14408 000013FA 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14409 000013FB FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14410 000013FD 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14411 000013FF 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14412 00001401 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14413 00001404 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14414 00001406 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14415 00001408 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14416 0000140A 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14417 0000140C 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14418 0000140E D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14419 00001410 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14420 00001412 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14421                                  no_wrap:				
 14422 00001414 F8                      		clc
 14423 00001415 5F                      		pop	di
 14424 00001416 07                      		pop	es
 14425 00001417 5B                      		pop	bx
 14426 00001418 58                      		pop	ax
 14427 00001419 C3                      		retn
 14428                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14429                                  
 14430                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14431 0000141A 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14432 0000141C FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14433 0000141E EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14434                                  
 14435                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14436                                  
 14437                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14438                                  
 14439                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14440                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14441                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14442                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14443                                  ;
 14444                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14445                                  
 14446                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14447                                  find_bds:	
 14448 00001420 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14449                                  fbds_1:					
 14450 00001424 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14451 00001428 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14452 0000142A 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14453                                  					; go to next bds
 14454 0000142D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14455 00001430 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14456 00001432 F9                      		stc
 14457                                  fdbs_2:					
 14458 00001433 C3                      		retn
 14459                                  
 14460                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14461                                  
 14462                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14463                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14464                                  doint:
 14465                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14466 00001434 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14467                                  					; get physical drive number
 14468                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14469                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14470                                  		
 14471 00001437 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14472 00001439 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14473 0000143B 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14474                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14475 0000143D 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14476                                  					; get request code
 14477                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14478 00001440 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14479                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14480 00001443 9D                      		popf
 14481                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14482                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14483 00001444 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14484                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14485                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14486 00001449 9C                      		pushf
 14487                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14488 0000144A 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14489                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14490                                  dointdone:				
 14491 0000144D C3                      		retn
 14492                                  
 14493                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14494                                  
 14495                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14496                                  
 14497                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14498                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14499                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14500                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14501                                  ;
 14502                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14503                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14504                                  ;
 14505                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14506                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14507                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14508                                  
 14509                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14510                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14511                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14512                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14513                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14514                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14515                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14516                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14517                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14518                                  ;end struc
 14519                                  
 14520                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14521                                  
 14522                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14523                                  ;	ah = function
 14524                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14525                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14526                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14527                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14528                                  ;   output conditions:
 14529                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14530                                  
 14531                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14532                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14533                                  ;
 14534                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14535                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14536                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14537                                  
 14538                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14539                                  
 14540                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14541                                  
 14542 0000144E 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14543                                  
 14544                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14545                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14546                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14547                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14548                                  
 14549                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14550                                  
 14551                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14552                                  
 14553                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14554                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14555                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14556                                  
 14557                                  format_special_stuff:
 14558 00001452 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 14559 00001457 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14560 00001459 53                      		push	bx
 14561 0000145A BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14562 0000145D E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14563 00001460 5B                      		pop	bx
 14564 00001461 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14565                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14566                                  
 14567                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14568                                  
 14569                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14570                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14571                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14572                                  
 14573                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14574                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 14575 00001463 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14576 00001465 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14577 00001467 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14578 00001468 51                      		push	cx
 14579 00001469 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14580 0000146B B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14581 0000146D D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14582 0000146F 8406[2805]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14583 00001473 59                      		pop	cx
 14584 00001474 58                      		pop	ax
 14585 00001475 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14586                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14587 00001477 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14588 00001478 06                      		push	es
 14589                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14590 00001479 2EC41E[4E14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14591                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14592                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14593 0000147E 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14594 00001480 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14595 00001483 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14596                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14597                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14598 00001487 07                      		pop	es
 14599 00001488 5B                      		pop	bx
 14600 00001489 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14601                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14602                                  
 14603                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14604                                  
 14605                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14606                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14607                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14608                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14609                                  
 14610                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 14611 0000148B 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14612                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14613 00001490 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14614 00001492 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14615                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14616 00001497 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14617                                  ps2_30_problem:
 14618 00001499 50                      		push	ax
 14619 0000149A B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14620                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14621                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14622 0000149C 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14623                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14624                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14625 000014A1 58                      		pop	ax
 14626 000014A2 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14627                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14628                                  
 14629                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14630                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14631                                  
 14632                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14633                                  
 14634                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14635                                  
 14636                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14637                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14638                                  
 14639                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14640 000014A4 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14641                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14642                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14643 000014A5 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14644                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14645                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14646                                  
 14647                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14648                                  
 14649 000014AA A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14650 000014AD 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14651 000014B0 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14652                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14653                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 14654 000014B2 803E[2805]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14655 000014B7 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14656                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14657                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14658                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 14659 000014B9 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14660                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14661                                  		
 14662 000014BE 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14663                                  		
 14664 000014BF 803E[3506]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14665                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14666 000014C4 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14667                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14668                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 14669 000014C6 9D                      		popf
 14670 000014C7 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14671                                  ret_from_i13:
 14672 000014C9 1F                      		pop	ds
 14673 000014CA CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14674                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14675                                  
 14676                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14677                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14678                                  ; a changeline error.
 14679                                  
 14680                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 14681 000014CD 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14682                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14683 000014CF 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14684 000014D2 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14685 000014D4 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14686 000014D6 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14687 000014D8 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14688 000014DD 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14689                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14690                                  					; never	would
 14691 000014DF 53                      		push	bx
 14692 000014E0 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14693 000014E3 E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14694 000014E6 5B                      		pop	bx
 14695                                  int13b:
 14696 000014E7 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14697 000014E8 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14698                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14699                                  
 14700                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14701                                  
 14702                                  goterr13:				
 14703 000014EA 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14704 000014ED 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14705                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14706 000014EF 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14707 000014F2 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14708 000014F4 803E[2F06]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14709 000014F9 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14710                                  
 14711 000014FB 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14712                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14713                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14714                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14715 00001500 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14716                                  
 14717 00001502 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14718                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14719                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14720 00001504 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14721                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14722                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14723 00001509 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14724 0000150C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14725 0000150E 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14726 00001510 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14727 00001512 53                      		push	bx
 14728 00001513 51                      		push	cx
 14729 00001514 52                      		push	dx
 14730 00001515 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14731                                  loop_ecc:
 14732 00001518 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14733                                  
 14734                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14735                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14736                                  ;
 14737                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14738                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14739                                  ; track.
 14740                                  ;
 14741                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14742                                  ; this request.
 14743                                  ;
 14744                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14745                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14746                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14747                                  ;
 14748 0000151B E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14749                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14750                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14751 0000151E 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14752                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14753 00001523 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14754 00001525 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14755 00001528 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14756 0000152A 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14757 0000152D 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14758                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14759                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14760                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14761 0000152F 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14762                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14763                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14764                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14765                                  ok11_op:
 14766 00001531 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14767 00001535 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14768 00001537 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14769                                  					; add 200h to address
 14770 00001539 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14771 0000153B FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14772 0000153D EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14773                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14774                                  
 14775                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14776                                  
 14777                                  ok11_exit_err:
 14778 0000153F F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14779                                  ok11_exit:
 14780 00001540 5A                      		pop	dx
 14781 00001541 59                      		pop	cx
 14782 00001542 5B                      		pop	bx
 14783 00001543 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14784                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14785                                  
 14786                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14787                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14788                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14789                                  
 14790                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 14791 00001545 06                      		push	es
 14792 00001546 53                      		push	bx
 14793 00001547 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14794 0000154A 1E                      		push	ds
 14795 0000154B 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14796 0000154C B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14797                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14798                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14799 0000154F 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14800                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14801 00001554 5B                      		pop	bx
 14802 00001555 07                      		pop	es
 14803 00001556 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14804 00001558 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14805 0000155B 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14806                                  
 14807                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14808                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14809                                  
 14810                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 14811 0000155D 56                      		push	si
 14812 0000155E 57                      		push	di
 14813 0000155F 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14814 00001561 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14815 00001564 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14816 00001567 5F                      		pop	di
 14817 00001568 5E                      		pop	si
 14818 00001569 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14819                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14820                                  
 14821                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14822                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14823                                  
 14824                                  gotdmaerr:
 14825 0000156B A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14826 0000156E FB                      		sti
 14827 0000156F 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14828 00001572 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14829                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14830                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14831 00001574 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14832 00001577 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14833 00001579 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14834 0000157C 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14835 0000157E 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14836                                  
 14837                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14838                                  
 14839                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14840                                  
 14841 00001580 52                      		push	dx
 14842 00001581 51                      		push	cx
 14843 00001582 53                      		push	bx
 14844 00001583 50                      		push	ax
 14845 00001584 55                      		push	bp
 14846 00001585 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14847 00001587 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14848 00001589 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14849 0000158B D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14850 0000158D D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14851 0000158F D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14852 00001591 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14853 00001593 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14854                                  
 14855                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14856                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14857                                  
 14858 00001597 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14859 00001599 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14860                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14861                                  
 14862                                  no_skip_first:
 14863 0000159C D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14864 0000159E B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14865 000015A0 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14866                                  
 14867                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14868                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14869                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14870                                  ;
 14871                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14872                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14873                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14874                                  ; in error.
 14875                                  
 14876 000015A2 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14877 000015A4 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14878                                  
 14879                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14880                                  
 14881 000015A6 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14882                                  					; set up head number
 14883 000015A9 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14884 000015AC E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14885                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14886                                  
 14887                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 14888 000015AF B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14889 000015B1 F9                      		stc
 14890 000015B2 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14891                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14892                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14893                                  
 14894                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14895                                  
 14896                                  intverify:
 14897 000015B5 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14898 000015B6 53                      		push	bx
 14899 000015B7 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14900 000015B8 07                      		pop	es
 14901                                  dosimple:
 14902 000015B9 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14903                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14904                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14905                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14906 000015BC 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14907                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14908 000015C1 5B                      		pop	bx
 14909 000015C2 07                      		pop	es
 14910 000015C3 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14911                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14912                                  
 14913                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14914                                  
 14915                                  intformat:
 14916 000015C6 06                      		push	es
 14917 000015C7 53                      		push	bx
 14918 000015C8 56                      		push	si
 14919 000015C9 57                      		push	di
 14920 000015CA 1E                      		push	ds
 14921                                  
 14922                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14923                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14924                                  
 14925 000015CB 06                      		push	es
 14926 000015CC 1E                      		push	ds
 14927 000015CD 07                      		pop	es
 14928 000015CE 1F                      		pop	ds
 14929 000015CF 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14930 000015D1 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14931 000015D4 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14932 000015D7 1F                      		pop	ds
 14933 000015D8 5F                      		pop	di
 14934 000015D9 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14935 000015DA EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14936                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14937                                  
 14938                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14939                                  ; the first block.
 14940                                  ;
 14941                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14942                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14943                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14944                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14945                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14946                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14947                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14948                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14949                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14950                                  
 14951                                  doblock:
 14952                                  
 14953                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14954                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14955                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14956                                  				
 14957 000015DC 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14958                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14959 000015DF 51                      		push	cx
 14960 000015E0 06                      		push	es
 14961 000015E1 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14962                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14963 000015E2 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14964 000015E5 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14965                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14966 000015E9 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14967                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14968 000015EE 5F                      		pop	di
 14969 000015EF 07                      		pop	es
 14970 000015F0 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14971 000015F2 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14972 000015F4 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14973 000015F6 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14974                                  doblockflop:
 14975 000015F8 59                      		pop	cx
 14976                                  doblockcontinue:
 14977 000015F9 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14978 000015FB 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14979 000015FD 50                      		push	ax
 14980 000015FE 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14981 00001600 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14982                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14983                                  
 14984                                  doblocklast:
 14985 00001602 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14986 00001604 50                      		push	ax
 14987                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 14988 00001605 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14989 00001608 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14990 0000160A 58                      		pop	ax
 14991 0000160B 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14992                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14993 0000160E 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14994 00001610 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14995 00001612 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14996 00001614 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14997 00001616 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14998                                  					; then we are done already.
 14999 00001618 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15000                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15001 0000161A E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15002 0000161D EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15003                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15004                                  
 15005                                  bufferx:
 15006 0000161F 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15007                                  					; set up head number
 15008                                  buffer:
 15009 00001622 53                      		push	bx
 15010 00001623 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15011 00001626 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15012 00001629 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15013                                  
 15014                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15015                                  
 15016 0000162B 06                      		push	es
 15017 0000162C 1E                      		push	ds
 15018 0000162D 56                      		push	si
 15019 0000162E 57                      		push	di
 15020 0000162F 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15021 00001630 06                      		push	es
 15022 00001631 1F                      		pop	ds
 15023 00001632 07                      		pop	es
 15024 00001633 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15025 00001636 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15026 00001637 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15027 00001639 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15028 0000163C 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15029                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15030 0000163D 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15031 0000163E 5E                      		pop	si
 15032 0000163F 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15033                                  
 15034                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15035                                  
 15036 00001640 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15037                                  					; get drive number
 15038 00001642 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15039 00001645 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15040                                  					;
 15041                                  					; ah is	function
 15042                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15043                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15044                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15045                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15046                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15047 00001648 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15048 0000164B 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15049 0000164C 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15050 0000164E EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15051                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15052                                  
 15053                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15054                                  
 15055                                  doread:
 15056 00001650 06                      		push	es
 15057 00001651 53                      		push	bx
 15058 00001652 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15059 00001653 07                      		pop	es
 15060 00001654 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15061 00001657 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15062 00001659 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15063                                  					; get drive number
 15064 0000165C E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15065                                  					; ah = function
 15066                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15067                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15068                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15069 0000165F E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15070 00001662 5B                      		pop	bx
 15071 00001663 07                      		pop	es
 15072 00001664 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15073 00001666 56                      		push	si
 15074 00001667 57                      		push	di
 15075 00001668 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15076 0000166A BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15077 0000166D E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15078 00001670 5F                      		pop	di
 15079 00001671 5E                      		pop	si
 15080                                  
 15081                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15082                                  
 15083                                  dotail:
 15084 00001672 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15085 00001673 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15086 00001676 41                      		inc	cx
 15087 00001677 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15088 0000167A F8                      		clc
 15089 0000167B FEC8                    		dec	al
 15090 0000167D 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15091                                  
 15092                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15093                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15094                                  
 15095 0000167F 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15096 00001682 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15097 00001685 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15098                                  
 15099                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15100                                  
 15101                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15102                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15103                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15104                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15105                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15106                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15107                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15108                                  
 15109                                  bad13:
 15110 00001688 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15111 0000168A 5D                      		pop	bp
 15112 0000168B 5B                      		pop	bx
 15113 0000168C 5B                      		pop	bx
 15114 0000168D 59                      		pop	cx
 15115 0000168E 5A                      		pop	dx
 15116 0000168F 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15117 00001691 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15118                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15119                                  
 15120                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 15121 00001694 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15122                                  
 15123                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15124                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15125                                  		;db 	0
 15126                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15127                                  
 15128                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15129                                  
 15130                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15131                                  
 15132                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15133                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 15134                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15135                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15136                                  
 15137                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15138                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 15139 00001697 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 15140 0000169B BF[7E06]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 15141 0000169E 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 15142 0000169F 07                      		pop	es
 15143 000016A0 E910EF                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 15144                                  
 15145                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15146                                  
 15147                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15148                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15149                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15150                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15151                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15152                                  
 15153                                  install_bds:		
 15154 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15155 000016A4 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15156                                  
 15157                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15158                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15159                                  loop_next_bds:				
 15160 000016A7 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15161                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15162 000016A9 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15163 000016AD 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15164                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15165 000016B0 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15166 000016B2 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15167 000016B4 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15168                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15169 000016B8 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15170 000016BB 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15171                                  					; we don't own it
 15172 000016C0 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15173                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15174 000016C3 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15175 000016C6 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15176                                  next_bds:				
 15177                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15178 000016CA B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15179 000016CD 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15180                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15181                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15182 000016CF 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 15183 000016D1 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 15184                                  					; install bds
 15185 000016D4 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 15186 000016D6 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15187                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15188                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15189 000016D9 1F                      		pop	ds
 15190                                  
 15191                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 15192                                  ;
 15193                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 15194                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 15195                                  ;
 15196                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 15197                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]

 15199                                  ;

 15201                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok

 15204 000016DA C3                      		retn

 15291                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15292                                  
 15293                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------
 15294                                  ; include msbio.cl2 (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 15295                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------
