 16503                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16504                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16505                                  
 16506                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16507                                  
 16508                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16509                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16510                                  ;
 16511                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16512                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16513                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16514                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16515                                  ;
 16516                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16517                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16518                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16519                                  
 16520                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16521                                  
 16522                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16523                                  
 16524                                  struc	DPB
 16525 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16526 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16527 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16528 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16529 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16530 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16531 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16532 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16533 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16534 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 16535                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16536 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 16537 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 16538 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 16539 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 16540 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 16541                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 16542 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 16543 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 16544 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 16545                                  .size:
 16546                                  endstruc

 16549

 16607                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 16608                                  
 16609                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 16610                                  ;
 16611                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 16612                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 16613                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 16614                                  ;
 16615                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 16616                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 16617                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 16618                                  ;
 16619                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 16620                                  
 16621                                  struc A_BPB
 16622 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 16623 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 16624 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 16625 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 16626 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 16627 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16628 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 16629 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1

 16900                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16901                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16902                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16903                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16904                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16905                                  									  
 16906                                  ;*******************************					  
 16907                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16908                                  ;*******************************					  
 16909                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16910                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16911                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16912                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16913                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16914                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16915                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16916                                  ;For all others:							  
 16917                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16918                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16919                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16920                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16921                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16922                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16923                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16924                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16925                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16926                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16927                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16928                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16929                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16930                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16931                                  ;									  
 16932                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16933                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16934                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16935                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16936                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16937                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16938                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16939                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16940                                  ;									  
 16941                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16942                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16943                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16944                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16945                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16946                                  ;									  
 16947                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16948                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16949                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16950                                  ;									  
 16951                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16952                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16953                                  ;									  
 16954                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16955                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16956                                  ;									  
 16957                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16958                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16959                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16960                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16961                                  ;						called. 		  
 16962                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16963                                  ;									  
 16964                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16965                                  ;									  
 16966                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16967                                  ;									  
 16968                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16969                                  ;									  
 16970                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16971                                  ;									  
 16972                                  
 16973                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16974                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16975 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16976 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16977                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16978 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16979 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16980 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16981 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16982                                  endstruc					  
 16983

 16985                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 16986                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 16987                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 16988                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 16989                                  					;;End of Modification

 17091                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17092                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17093                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17094                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17095                                  
 17096                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 17097                                  ;
 17098                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 17099                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 17100                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 17101                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 17102                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 17103                                  ;
 17104                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 17105                                  ;
 17106                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 17107                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 17108                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 17109                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 17110                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 17111                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 17112                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 17113                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 17114                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 17115                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 17116                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 17117                                  
 17118                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 17119                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 17120                                  
 17121                                  struc 		curdir_list
 17122                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17123 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 17124 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 17125 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 17126 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 17127 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 17128 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 17129                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 17130 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 17131 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 17132 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 17133                                  .size:
 17134                                  endstruc
 17135                                  
 17136                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 17137                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 17138                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 17139                                  						; argument
 17140                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 17141                                  
 17142                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 17143                                  
 17144                                  ;Flag word masks
 17145                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17146                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17147                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 17148                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 17149                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 17151                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17152                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17153                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17154                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17155                                  
 17156                                  ; system file table
 17157                                  
 17158                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 17159                                  ;
 17160                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 17161                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 17162                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 17163                                  
 17164                                  struc	SF
 17165 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 17166 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 17167 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 17168                                  .size:
 17169                                  endstruc
 17170                                  
 17171                                  ;**	System file table entry
 17172                                  ;
 17173                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 17174                                  
 17175                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 17176 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 17177                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 17178 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 17179 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 17180 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 17181                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 17182                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 17183                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 17184                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 17185                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 17186                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 17187                                  					;   (WRITE)
 17188                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 17189                                  					;
 17190                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 17191                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 17192                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 17193                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 17194                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 17195                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 17196                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 17197                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 17198                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 17199                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 17200                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 17201                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 17202 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 17203                                  					; to device header if local device,
 17204                                  					; points to net device header if
 17205                                  					; remote
 17206 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 17207                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 17208 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 17209 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 17210 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 17211 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 17212                                  ;
 17213                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 17214                                  ; ID
 17215                                  ;
 17216 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 17217 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 17218 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 17219                                  ;
 17220                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 17221                                  ;
 17222 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 17223                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 17224                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 17225                                  					; disk changed errors.
 17226                                  ; SHARING INFO
 17227 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 17228 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 17229 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 17230 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 17231 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 17232 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 17233                                  .size:
 17234                                  endstruc

 17513                                  ; 05/07/2018
 17514                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17515                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17516                                  
 17517                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17518                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17519                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17520                                  
 17521                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17522                                  ;
 17523                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17524                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17525                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17526                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17527                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17528                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17529                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17530                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17531                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17532                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 17533                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 17534                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 17535                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 17536                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 17537                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 17538                                  ;
 17539                                  
 17540                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 17541                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 17542                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 17543                                  ;
 17544                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 17545                                  ;
 17546                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 17547                                  ;
 17548                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 17549                                  ;
 17550                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 17551                                  ;
 17552                                  
 17553                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 17554                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 17555                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 17556                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 17557                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 17558                                  ;      deeply nested one
 17559                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 17560                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 17561                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 17562                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 17563                                  
 17564                                  		;EVEN
 17565                                  ;align 2
 17566                                  		; 21/10/2022
 17567                                  
 17568 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 17569 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 17570 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 17571 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 17572 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 17573 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 17574                                  
 17575 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 17576 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17577 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17578                                  
 17579                                  ;***********************************************************************
 17580                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 17581                                  
 17582                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17583                                  
 17584 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 17585                                  
 17586                                  int02:
 17587                                  
 17588                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17589                                  ;
 17590                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 17591                                  ;
 17592                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 17593                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 17594                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 17595                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 17596                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 17597                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 17598                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 17599                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 17600                                  ;
 17601                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 17602                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 17603                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 17604                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 17605                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 17606                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 17607                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 17608                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 17609                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 17610                                  ;
 17611                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17612                                  
 17613 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 17614 00000017 06                      	push	es
 17615 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 17616 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17617                                  	; 02/11/2022
 17618 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 17619 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 17620 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 17621                                  
 17622 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 17623                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 17624                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 17625                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 17626                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 17627 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 17628 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 17629                                  special02:
 17630 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 17631 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 17632                                  normal02:
 17633 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 17634 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17635 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 17863                                  ;********************************************************************
 17864                                  ;common routines
 17865                                  ;********************************************************************
 17866                                  
 17867                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17868                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17869                                  ; service routine
 17870                                  
 17871                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17872                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17873                                  
 17874                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17875                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17876                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17877                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17878                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17879                                  
 17880                                  do_int_stacks:
 17881 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17882 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17883 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17884 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17885 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17886 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17887                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17888                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17889                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17890 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17891 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17892 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 17893                                  
 17894 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17895                                  
 17896                                  found02:
 17897 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17898 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17899                                  
 17900 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17901                                  
 17902 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17903                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17904                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17905                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17906                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17907 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17908 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17909                                  
 17910                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17911                                  	;mov	es,bp
 17912                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 17913                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17914                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 17915                                  	;mov	sp,es
 17916                                  	;mov	es,ax
 17917                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17918                                  
 17919                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 17920 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 17921 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 17922 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17923 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 17924 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 17925 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 17926 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 17927 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 17928                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17929                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17930 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17931                                  
 17932 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17933                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17934 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17935                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17936                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17937                                  
 17938 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17939                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17940 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17941                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17942                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17943 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17944 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17945                                  
 17946                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17947                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17948                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17949 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17950 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17951                                  
 17952 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 17953 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17954 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17955 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 17956 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17957                                  
 17958                                  notfree02:
 17959 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17960 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 17961                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17962                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 17963                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17964 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17965                                  
 17966                                  findnext02:
 17967 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17968 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 17969                                  
 17970                                  foundbad02:
 17971 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17972 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17973 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17974                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17975                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17976                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17977 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17978 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17979                                  
 17980                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17981                                  
 17982                                  ; Common routines
 17983                                  
 17984                                  longpath:
 17985                                  	; 21/03/2019
 17986 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 17987                                  lploopp:
 17988                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17989                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 17990                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17991 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 17992 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 17993                                  
 17994 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 17995                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17996                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 17997                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17998 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17999 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 18000 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 18001                                  
 18002 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 18003 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 18004                                  
 18005                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18006                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 18007                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18008 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 18009                                  inuse:
 18010 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18011 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 18012 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 18013 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 18014                                  found:
 18015 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 18016                                  fatal:
 18017 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 18018 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 18019 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18020 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 18021 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 18022 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 18023                                  
 18024 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 18025 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 18026                                  
 18027                                  skip_nmis:
 18028 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 18029 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 18030 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 18031 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 18032                                  
 18033 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 18034 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 18035 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 18036                                  ;SR;
 18037                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 18038                                  ;
 18039 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 18040 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 18041                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 18042                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 18043                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18044 00000217 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 18045 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18046                                  
 18047                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 18048 0000021C F606[C508]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 18049 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 18050 00000222 58                      	pop	ax
 18051 00000223 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 18052                                  
 18053                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 18054                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 18055                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18056 00000225 9A[C608]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 18057                                  ;
 18058                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 18059                                  ;
 18060                                  fatal_loop:
 18061 0000022A AC                      	lodsb
 18062 0000022B 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 18063 0000022D 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 18064                                  
 18065 0000022F B307                    	mov	bl,7
 18066 00000231 B40E                    	mov	ah,14
 18067 00000233 CD10                    	int	10h			; whoops, this enables ints
 18068 00000235 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop
 18069                                  
 18070                                  fatal_done:
 18071 00000237 EBFE                    	jmp	short fatal_done
 18072                                  
 18073                                  
 18074                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSINIT1.ASM, 1991)
 18075                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19230                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 19231                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 19232                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 19233                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19234                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 19235                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 19236                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 19237                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 19238                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 19239                                  ;
 19240                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 19241                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 19242                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 19243                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19244                                  ; been patched.
 19245                                  
 19246                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0

 19525                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 19526                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 19527                                  ;   which follow....)
 19528                                  
 19529                                  retry:
 19530 000007D4 BA[5C33]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 19531                                  
 19532                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 19533                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 19534                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 19535                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 19536                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 19537                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 19538                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 19539                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 19540                                  
 19541                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 19542                                  
 19543 000007D7 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 19544 000007D8 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19545 000007DB B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 19546 000007DD CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 19547 000007DF B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 19548 000007E1 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 19549 000007E3 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 19550                                  
 19551 000007E5 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19552 000007E7 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 19553 000007E9 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 19554 000007EB 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 19555                                  
 19556                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 19557                                  
 19558                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 19559                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 19560                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 19561                                  
 19562                                  	; 22/10/2022
 19563                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 19564 000007ED 8B1E[9202]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 19565 000007F1 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 19566                                  
 19567                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 19568                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 19569                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 19570                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 19571                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 19572                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 19573                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 19574                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 19575                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 19576                                  ;
 19577                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 19578                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 19579                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 19580                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 19581                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 19582                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 19583                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 19584                                  
 19585                                  	; 22/10/2022
 19586                                  	;mov	cx,[config_envlen]

 19833                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem

 19835                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19836                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made

 19841                                  ;	   free memory.

 19928                                  ;
 19929                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19930                                  ;
 19931                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19932                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19933                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19934                                  ;
 19935                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19936                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19937                                  ; 
 19938                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19973                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi

 19976                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19977                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19978                                  ;
 19979                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed

 20007

 20302                                  ;
 20303                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20304                                  
 20305                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20306                                  
 20307                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 20308                                  
 20309                                  AllocMemForDOS:
 20310                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20311                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20312                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20313                                  	; ds = cs
 20314                                  	;mov	ax,BCode_end
 20315                                  	;sub	ax,BCode_start		; BIOS code size
 20316                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20317 0000094A B8A019                  	mov	ax,BCODE_END ; 1A60h

 20319                                  	; 09/12/2022
 20320 0000094D 2D[3000]                	sub	ax,BCODESTART 
 20321                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 20322                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20323                                  	;add	ax,[cs:lo_doscod_size]	; DOS code size
 20324                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20325                                  	; ds = cs
 20326 00000950 0306[7F02]              	add	ax,[lo_doscod_size]
 20327 00000954 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20328 00000957 E86202                  	call	off_to_para			; convert to para
 20329                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20333 0000095C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc
 20334 0000095E 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 20335 00000960 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 20336 00000962 CD21                    	int	21h
 20337 00000964 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 20338                                   	; 23/10/2022
 20339                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 20340 00000966 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 20341                                  						;  BIOS code

 20343                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 20344                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 20345                                  	; 14/05/2019

 20351                                  
 20352 00000979 C3                      	retn
 20353                                  
 20354                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20355                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20356                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20357                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20358                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20359                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20360                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20361                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20362                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20363                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20364                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20365                                  ;
 20366                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20367                                  
 20368                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20369                                  update_arena:
 20370 0000097A 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20371 0000097B 57                      	push	di
 20372 0000097C 51                      	push	cx
 20373 0000097D 52                      	push	dx
 20374                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20375                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20376                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20377                                  	; ds = cs 
 20378 0000097E C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20379 00000982 4F                      	dec	di
 20380 00000983 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20381                                  						;  before sysvar
 20382 00000984 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20383                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20384 00000986 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20385 0000098B 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20386 0000098D 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20387                                  
 20388                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20389 0000098F 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20390 00000994 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20391 00000996 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20392 00000998 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20393 0000099A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20394                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20395 0000099C 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20396                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20397 000009A0 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20398 000009A6 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20399                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20400 000009A8 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20401 000009AC 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20402                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20403                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20404 000009AE 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20405 000009B1 5A                      	pop	dx
 20406 000009B2 59                      	pop	cx
 20407 000009B3 5F                      	pop	di
 20408 000009B4 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20409 000009B5 C3                      	retn
 20410                                  ;
 20411                                  ; M012 : END
 20412                                  ;
 20413                                  FatalErr:
 20414 000009B6 0E                      	push	cs
 20415 000009B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 20416 000009B8 BA[8308]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 20417 000009BB B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20418 000009BD CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20419                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20420                                          ;jmp	stall
 20421                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20422 000009BF FA                      	cli
 20423 000009C0 F4                      	hlt
 20424                                  
 20425                                  ;endif ;ROMDOS

 20427                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20428                                  
 20429                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20430                                  ;
 20431                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20432                                  ;
 20433                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20434                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20435                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20436                                  ;
 20437                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20438                                  ;
 20439                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20440                                  
 20441                                  AllocHMA:
 20442                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20443                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20444                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20445                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20446                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20447                                  
 20448                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20449                                  ;
 20450                                  ;	xor	ax,ax

 20600                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20601                                  ;
 20602                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20603                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20604                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20605                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20606                                  ;
 20607                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20608                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20609                                  ;
 20610                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20611                                  
 20612                                  StartVDHead:
 20613                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20614                                  
 20615 00000A39 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20616 00000A3D 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20617 00000A3F 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20618 00000A41 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20619 00000A43 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20620                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20621 00000A44 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20622                                  VDiskSig1:
 20623 00000A4B 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20624                                  
 20625                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20626                                  
 20627 00000A50 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20628                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20629 00000A56 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20630 00000A65 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20631 00000A67 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20632                                  VDInt19:
 20633 00000A68 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20634                                  OldVDInt19:
 20635 00000A69 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20636                                  
 20637                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20638                                  
 20639                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20640 00000A6D 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20641                                  VDiskSig2:
 20642 00000A70 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20643                                  
 20644                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20645                                  
 20646 00000A75 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20647 00000A78 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20648 00000A7A 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20649 00000A7B 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20650 00000A7D 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20651 00000A7E 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20652 00000A80 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20653 00000A82 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20654 00000A83 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20655 00000A85 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20656 00000A87 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20657 00000A89 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20658 00000A8B 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20659                                  
 20660                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20662                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20663                                  ;
 20664                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20665                                  ;
 20666                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20667                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20668                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20669                                  ;
 20670                                  ; Inputs : None
 20671                                  ;
 20672                                  ; Outputs : None
 20673                                  ;
 20674                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20675                                  ;
 20676                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20677                                  
 20678                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20679                                  
 20680                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20681 00000A8D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20682 00000A8F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20683                                  
 20684                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20685                                  
 20686                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20687 00000A91 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20688                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20689 00000A94 2EA3[690A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20690 00000A98 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20691                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20692 00000A9B 2EA3[6B0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20693                                  
 20694                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20695                                  
 20696 00000A9F B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20697                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20698                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20699 00000AA1 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20700 00000AA4 CD21                    	int	21h
 20701                                  
 20702                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20703                                  
 20704 00000AA6 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20705 00000AA7 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20706                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20707 00000AA9 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20708                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20709 00000AB0 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20710 00000AB7 40                      	inc	ax
 20711 00000AB8 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20712                                  
 20713                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20714                                  
 20715 00000ABA FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20716                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20717 00000ABB C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20718 00000AC1 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20719                                  
 20720                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20721

 20731

 20733                                  
 20734                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20739                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20740                                  	; 04/09/2023

 20750

 20801                                  
 20802                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20803                                  
 20804                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20805                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20806                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20807                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20808                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20809                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20810                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20811                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20812                                  ;								      ;I070
 20813                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20814                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20815                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20816                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20817                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20818                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20819                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20820                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20821                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20822                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20823                                  ;								      ;I070
 20824                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20825                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20826                                  
 20827                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20828                                  	; ds = cs
 20829

 20831 00000B36 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs

 20834 00000B3C D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20835 00000B3E B104                    	mov	cl,4

 20949                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20950                                  ;
 20951                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20952                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20953                                  ;
 20954                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20955                                  
 20956                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20957                                  CPMHack:
 20958 00000BA6 1E                      	push	ds
 20959 00000BA7 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20960 00000BAA 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20961                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20962                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20963 00000BAC 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20964 00000BAD 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20965 00000BAF BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20966 00000BB2 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20967                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20968 00000BB5 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20969 00000BB7 FC                      	cld
 20970 00000BB8 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20971 00000BBA 1F                      	pop	ds
 20972 00000BBB C3                      	retn

 21855                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21856                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21857                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21858                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21859                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21860                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21861                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21862                                  ;
 21863                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21864                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21865                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21866                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21867                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21868                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21869                                  ;
 21870                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21871                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21872                                  ;
 21873                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21874                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21875                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21876                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21877                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21878                                  ;
 21879                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21880                                  ;
 21881                                  ;			  none.
 21882                                  
 21883                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21884                                  ;
 21885                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21886                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21887                                  
 21888                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21889
