 22092                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22093                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22094                                  ;
 22095                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22096                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22097                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22098                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22099                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22100                                  ; program).
 22101                                  
 22102                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22103                                  
 22104                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22105                                  
 22106 00001024 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22107                                  
 22108                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22109                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22110                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22111                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22112                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22113                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22114                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22115                                  ; carridge return.
 22116                                  
 22117                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22118                                  ;character after =.
 22119                                  
 22120 00001025 06                      	push	es
 22121 00001026 1E                      	push	ds
 22122 00001027 07                      	pop	es
 22123 00001028 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22124 00001029 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22125                                  
 22126 0000102B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22127 0000102D FC                      	cld
 22128 0000102E 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22129 00001034 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 22130                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 22131 00001037 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 22132 00001038 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 22133 0000103A 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 22134 0000103C EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 22135                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 22136 0000103E AC                      	lodsb
 22137 0000103F 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 22138 00001042 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 22139 00001044 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 22140 00001046 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 22141 00001048 47                      	inc	di
 22142 00001049 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 22143                                  done_installparm:
 22144 0000104B 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 22145 00001050 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 22146 00001053 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 22147 00001055 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh

 22240                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22241                                  ;
 22242                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22243                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22244                                  ;
 22245                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22246                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22247                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22248                                  
 22249                                  ParaRound:
 22250 000010A4 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22251 000010A7 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22252 000010A9 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22253 000010AB D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22254 000010AD D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22255 000010AF C3                      	retn

 22257                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22258                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22259                                  ;
 22260                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22261                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22262                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22263                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22264                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22265                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22266                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22267                                  ;
 22268                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22269                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22270                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22271                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22272                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22273                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22274                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22275                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22276                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22277                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22278                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22279                                  ;
 22280                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22281                                  
 22282                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22283                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22284                                  sysinit_base:				
 22285 000010B0 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22286 000010B5 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22287 000010BA CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22288 000010BC 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22289 000010C1 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22290 000010C6 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22291 000010C7 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22292 000010C8 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22293                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22294                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22295 000010CA E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22296 000010CD 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22297 000010D2 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22298                                  
 22299                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22300                                  
 22301 000010D4 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22302 000010D6 0E                      	push	cs
 22303 000010D7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22304 000010D8 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22305 000010DB CD21                    	int	21h
 22306                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22307                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22308                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22309                                  _stall: 
 22310                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22311 000010DD F4                      	hlt 
 22312                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22313                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22314 000010DE EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22315                                  
 22316                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22317 000010E0 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22318                                  
 22319                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22320                                  
 22321                                  sum_up:
 22322                                  
 22323                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22324                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22325                                  ;
 22326                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22327                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22328                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22329                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22330                                  ;
 22331                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22332                                  
 22333 000010E5 1E                      	push	ds
 22334                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22335                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22336 000010E6 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22337 000010EA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22338 000010EC 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22339 000010EE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22340 000010F0 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22341                                  					;whole test better fail.
 22342 000010F5 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22343 000010F7 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22344                                  sum1:
 22345 000010F9 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22346 000010FB 46                      	inc	si
 22347 000010FC 46                      	inc	si
 22348 000010FD E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22349                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22350                                  sum_sys_code:
 22351                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22352 000010FF BEFE10                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22353                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22354                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22355                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22356                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22357                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22358                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 22359                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 22360 00001102 B9[F037]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22361 00001105 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22362 00001107 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22363                                  sum2:
 22364 00001109 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22365 0000110C 46                      	inc	si
 22366 0000110D 46                      	inc	si
 22367 0000110E E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22368 00001110 1F                      	pop	ds
 22369 00001111 C3                      	retn
 22370                                  
 22371                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22372                                  
 22373                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22374                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 22375 00001112 0000                    	dw	0
 22376                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22377                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 22378 00001114 0000                    	dw	0
 22379                                  
 22380                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 22381                                  
 22382                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 22383                                  
 22384                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h
 22385 00001116 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 22386 00001118 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 22386 00001121 6C6F636174696F6E20-
 22386 0000112A 6572726F722024     
 22387                                  
 22388                                  end_sysinit_base: ; label byte
 22389                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22390                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22391                                  
 22392                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22393                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22394                                  ;
 22395                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22396                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22397                                  ;
 22398                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22399                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22400                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22401                                  ;
 22402                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22403                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22404                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22405                                  
 22406                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22407                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 22408                                  
 22409                                  set_buffer:
 22410 00001131 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22411 00001133 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22412 00001136 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22413                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 22414                                  	; 17/09/2023
 22415 00001138 FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 22416                                  set_buff_1:
 22417                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22418                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 22419 0000113A 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 22420                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 22421 0000113C 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 22422                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 22423 0000113F C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22424                                  
 22425 00001144 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22426 00001146 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22427 0000114B 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22428                                  
 22429                                  ;	for each buffer
 22430                                  
 22431                                  nxt_buff:
 22432 0000114C E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22433 0000114F 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 22434 00001151 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 22435                                  
 22436 00001153 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22437                                  
 22438 00001158 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22439                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22440 00001159 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22441 0000115C 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22442                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22443                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22444 0000115E 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22445                                  
 22446 00001162 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 22447 00001164 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22448                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22449 00001166 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22450 0000116A 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22451                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 22452 0000116E C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22453                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22454 00001173 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22455 00001176 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22456                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 22457 0000117A 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22458                                  set_buff_2:
 22459 0000117D 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22460                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22461 00001182 2E800E[1014]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22462                                  	;call	round
 22463                                  	;retn
 22464                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22465 00001188 E9851E                  	jmp	round
 22466                                  
 22467                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22468                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22469                                  ;
 22470                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22471                                  ;
 22472                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22473                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22474                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22475                                  
 22476                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22477                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22478 0000118B 53                      	push	bx
 22479 0000118C 52                      	push	dx
 22480 0000118D 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22481 00001191 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22482                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22483 00001196 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22484                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22485                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22486                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22487 00001199 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22488 0000119B 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22489 0000119D B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22490                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22491 000011A0 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22492 000011A2 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22493 000011A5 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22494                                  
 22495                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22496                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22497                                  	; zf=1
 22498 000011A7 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22499                                  	; zf=1
 22500                                  
 22501                                  	;zf=1
 22502                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22503                                  	;zf=1
 22504 000011A8 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22505                                  got_hma:
 22506 000011AD 5A                      	pop	dx
 22507 000011AE 5B                      	pop	bx
 22508 000011AF C3                      	retn
 22509

 22511                                  
 22512                                  set_buffer_info:
 22513                                  
 22514                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 22515                                  ;
 22516                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 22517                                  ;    ax = di
 22518                                  ;
 22519                                  ;out:
 22520                                  ;    above entries set.
 22521                                  
 22522                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22523 000011B0 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 22524                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 22525 000011B5 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22526 000011B9 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22527 000011BD 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 22528                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22529 000011C2 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 22530                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 22531 000011C5 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22532                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22533 000011CB 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22534                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22535 000011D1 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22536 000011D7 C3                      	retn
 22537                                  
 22538                                  ; ======================================================================
 22539                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22540                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22541                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22542                                  
 22543                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22544                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22545                                  ;
 22546                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22547                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22548                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22549                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22550                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22551                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22552                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22553                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22554                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22555                                  ;
 22556                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22557                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22558                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22559                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22560                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22561                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22562                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22563                                  ;	conditions:
 22564                                  ;
 22565                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22566                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22567                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22568                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22569                                  ;
 22570                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22571                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22572                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22573                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22574                                  ;
 22575                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22576                                  ;
 22577                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22578                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22579                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22580                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22581                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22582                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22583                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22584                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22585                                  ;
 22586                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22587                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22588                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22589                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22590                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22591                                  ;
 22592                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22593                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22594                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22595                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22596                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22597                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22598                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22599                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22600                                  ;
 22601                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22602                                  
 22603                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22604                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22605                                  
 22606                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22607                                  stackinit:
 22608 000011D8 50                      	push	ax
 22609 000011D9 1E                      	push	ds
 22610 000011DA 06                      	push	es
 22611 000011DB 53                      	push	bx
 22612 000011DC 51                      	push	cx
 22613 000011DD 52                      	push	dx
 22614 000011DE 57                      	push	di
 22615 000011DF 56                      	push	si
 22616 000011E0 55                      	push	bp
 22617                                  
 22618                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22619                                  
 22620                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22621                                  	; ds = cs
 22622 000011E1 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22623 000011E4 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22624                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22625                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22626                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22627 000011E6 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22628                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22629 000011EA A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22630 000011ED 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22631                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22632 000011F1 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22633                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22634                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22635                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22636 000011F4 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22637                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22638 000011F8 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22639 000011FA A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22640                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22641                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22642                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22643 000011FD 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22644                                  
 22645                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22646                                  
 22647                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22648                                  
 22649                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22650                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22651                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22652 00001201 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22653                                  
 22654                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22655                                  
 22656 00001206 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22657                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22658                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22659                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22660 00001209 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22661 0000120B 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22662 0000120D 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22663 00001211 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22664 00001213 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22665                                  
 22666                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22667                                  
 22668 00001216 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22669 0000121B 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22670 0000121F F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22671 00001221 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22672 00001223 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22673 00001225 06                      	push	es
 22674 00001226 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22675                                  
 22676                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22677                                  
 22678 00001227 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22679 0000122B FC                      	cld
 22680 0000122C F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22681                                  
 22682 0000122E 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22683                                  
 22684                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22685                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22686                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22687                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22688                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22689                                  
 22690                                  buildloop:
 22691                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22692                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22693                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22694                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 22695                                  	; 14/08/2023
 22696 00001232 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 22697 00001236 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 22698                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22699 0000123A 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 22700                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 22701 0000123E 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 22702                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 22703 00001242 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 22704 00001246 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 22705                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 22706 0000124A 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 22707 0000124D 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22708                                  
 22709 00001250 E2E0                    	loop	buildloop

 23445                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23446                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23447                                  
 23448                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23449                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23450                                  
 23451                                  new_init_loop:
 23452                                  
 23453                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23454                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23455                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23456                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23457                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23458                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23459                                  
 23460 000013CA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23461 000013CD 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23462 000013CF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23463 000013D3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23464                                  
 23465 000013D6 1E                      	push	ds
 23466                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23467                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23468                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23469 000013D7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23470 000013DA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23471 000013DC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23472 000013DF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23473 000013E1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23474 000013E5 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23475 000013E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 23476                                  
 23477 000013E9 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23478 000013EC 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23479 000013F0 C3                      	retn
 23480                                  
 23481                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23490                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]

 23766                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23767                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23768                                  ;
 23769                                  ;
 23770                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23771                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23772                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23773                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23774                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23775                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23776                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23777                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23778                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23779                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23780                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23781                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23782                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23783                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23784                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23785                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23786                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23787                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23788                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23789                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23790                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23791                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23792                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23793                                  ;	   :
 23794                                  ;
 23795                                  ;Note:
 23796                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23797                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23798                                  ;
 23799                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23800                                  ;
 23801                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23802                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23803                                  ;
 23804                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23805                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23806                                  ;
 23807                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23808                                  ;
 23809                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23810                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23811                                  ;
 23812                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23813                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23814                                  ;
 23815                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23816                                  ;
 23817                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23818                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23819                                  ;
 23820                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23821                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23822                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23823                                  ;
 23824                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23825                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23826                                  ;
 23827                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23828                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23829                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23830                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23831                                  
 23832                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23833                                  
 23834                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23835                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23836                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23837                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23838                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23839                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23840                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23841                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23842                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23843                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23844                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23845                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23846                                  
 23847                                  ;**** Function flags
 23848                                  
 23849                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23850                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23851                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23852                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23853                                  
 23854                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23855                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23856 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23857 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23858 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23859 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23860 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23861 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23862                                  endstruc
 23863                                  
 23864                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23865                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23866                                  ;
 23867                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23868                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23869                                  ;	     +-
 23870                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23871                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23872                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23873                                  ;	     |	:
 23874                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23875                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23876                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23877                                  ;	     |	:
 23878                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23879                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23880                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23881                                  ;	     +-	:
 23882                                  ;
 23883                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23884                                  ;
 23885                                  ;Note:
 23886                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23887                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23888                                  ;
 23889                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23890                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23891                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23892                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23893                                  
 23894                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23895                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23896                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23897                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23898                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23899                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23900                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23901                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23902                                  
 23903                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23904 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23905 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23906 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23907 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23908 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23909                                  endstruc
 23910                                  
 23911                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23912                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23913                                  ;
 23914                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23915                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23916                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23917                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23918                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23919                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23920                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23921                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23922                                  ;
 23923                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23924                                  ;
 23925                                  ;            +-
 23926                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23927                                  ;	    | or
 23928                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23929                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23930                                  ;	    | or
 23931                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23932                                  ;	    | or
 23933                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23934                                  ;	    | or
 23935                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23936                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23937                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23938                                  ;	    | or
 23939                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23940                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23941                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23942                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23943                                  ;	    +-
 23944                                  ;
 23945                                  ;
 23946                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23947                                  ;      list.
 23948                                  ;
 23949                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23950                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23951                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23952                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23953                                  
 23954                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23955                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23956 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23957 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23958 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23959 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23960                                  endstruc

 23967                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 23968                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 23969                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 23970                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 23971                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 23972                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 23973                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 23974                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String

 23981

 23983                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 23984                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23985                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23986                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23987                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23988                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23989                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23990                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23991                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24071                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 24073                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24074                                  
 24075                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24076                                  ; SysParse;
 24077                                  ;
 24078                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24079                                  ;
 24080                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24081                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24082                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24083                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24084                                  ;
 24085                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24086                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24087                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24088                                  ;
 24089                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24090                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24091                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24092                                  ;
 24093                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24094                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24095                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24096                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24097                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24098                                  ;
 24099                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24100                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24101                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24102                                  ;
 24103                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24104                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24105                                  ;
 24106                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24107                                  ;
 24108                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24109                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24110                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24111                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24112                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24113                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24114                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24115                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24116                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24117                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24118                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24119                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24120                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24121                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24122                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24123                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24124                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24125                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24126                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24127                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24128                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24129                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24130                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24131                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24132                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24133                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24134                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24135                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24136                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24137                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24138                                  
 24139                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24140                                  
 24141                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24142                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24143                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24144                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24145                                  
 24146                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24147                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24148                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24149                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24150                                  ;
 24151                                  
 24152                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24153                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24154                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24155                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24156                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24157                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24158                                  
 24159                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24160                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24161                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24162                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24163                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24164                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24165                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24166                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24167                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24168                                  
 24169                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24170                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24171                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24172                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24173                                  ;	     segment.
 24174                                  
 24175                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24176                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24177                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24178                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24179                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24180                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24181                                  
 24182                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 24183                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 24184                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 24185                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 24186                                  
 24187                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 24188                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 24189                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 24190                                  
 24191                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 24192                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 24193                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 24194                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 24195                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 24196                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 24197                                  
 24198                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 24199                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 24200                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 24201                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 24202                                  
 24203                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 24204                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 24205                                  
 24206                                  ;	     The code and PSDATA.INC have been aligned for ease of reading.
 24207

 24209                                  ;	     psdata buffer should have cs.

 24545                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24546                                  ; _$P_Chk_Pos_Control
 24547                                  ;
 24548                                  ; Function: Parse CONTROL block for a positional
 24549                                  ;
 24550                                  ; Input:     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24551                                  ;	     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24552                                  ;
 24553                                  ; Output:    None
 24554                                  ;
 24555                                  ; Use:	 _$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_Match_Flags

 24772                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24773                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24774                                  ;
 24775                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24776                                  ;
 24777                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24778                                  ;	    AL = type
 24779                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24780                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24781                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24782                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24783                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24784                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths

 24786                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24787                                  ;
 24788                                  ; Output:   None
 24789                                  ;
 24790                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24791                                  ;

 24793                                  ;***********************************************************************

 24886                                  ;
 24887                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 24888                                  ;	     result buffer
 24889                                  ;
 24890                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 24891                                  ;		Complex

 24893                                  ;		Time
 24894                                  ;		Drive
 24895                                  ;		Filespec
 24896                                  ;		Quoted String
 24897                                  ;		Simple String
 24898                                  ;
 24899                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24900                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24901                                  ;
 24902                                  ; Output:    None
 24903                                  ;
 24904                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 24905                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 24906                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format

 25189                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25190                                  ;
 25191                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25192                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25193                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25194                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25195                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25196                                  ;
 25197                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25198                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 25200                                  ; Output:    None

 25203                                  ;
 25204                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25205                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25206                                  
 25207                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25208                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25209                                  
 25210                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25211 0000187C 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25212 0000187D 2E800E[2314]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25213 00001883 2E8026[2314]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25214 00001889 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25215 0000188C 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25216 0000188E 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25217

 25220

 25222                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;

 26094                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26095                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26096                                  
 26097                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26098 00001BC7 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26099 00001BC8 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26100 00001BC9 2EC606[1D14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26101                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26102                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26103 00001BCF 2E8026[2314]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26104 00001BD5 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26105 00001BD7 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26106                                  
 26107 00001BD9 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26108 00001BDB 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26109                                  
 26110 00001BDD 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26111 00001BDF 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26112                                  
 26113                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26114                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26115                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 14/08/2023
 26116                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26117                                  %if 0
 26118                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26119                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26120                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26121                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26122                                  
 26123                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26124                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26125                                  
 26126                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26127                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26128                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26129                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26130                                  %endif
 26131                                  
 26132                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26133 00001BE1 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26134                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26135 00001BE6 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26136                                  
 26137                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26138 00001BE8 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26139                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26140 00001BEA 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26141                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26142                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26143                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26144                                  	; 14/08/2023
 26145 00001BEE E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ

 26147 00001BF0 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26148                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26149 00001BF3 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;

 26151 00001BF7 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
