 26178                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26179                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26180                                  ;
 26181                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26182                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26183                                  ;
 26184                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26185                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26186                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26187                                  ;
 26188                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26189                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26190                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26191                                  
 26192                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26193                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26194                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26195                                  ;
 26196                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26197                                  
 26198                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26199                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26200                                  
 26201                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26202                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26203                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26204                                  	; 14/08/2023
 26205 00001C15 BD[2C14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26206                                  
 26207                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26208 00001C18 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26209 00001C1A 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26210                                  
 26211                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26212 00001C1C 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26213 00001C1E 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26214                                  
 26215 00001C20 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26216                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26217                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26218 00001C21 C3                      	retn
 26219                                  
 26220                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26221                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26222                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26223                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26224                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26225                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26226                                  
 26227                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26228                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26229 00001C22 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26230 00001C24 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26231                                  
 26232 00001C26 2E800E[2314]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26233                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26234                                  
 26235                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26236                                  	; cf=0
 26237                                  	;retn
 26238                                  
 26239                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26240                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26241                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26242 00001C2C F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26243                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26244                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26245 00001C2D C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26247                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26248                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26249                                  ;
 26250                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26251                                  ;
 26252                                  ;  Input:
 26253                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26254                                  ;
 26255                                  ;  Output:
 26256                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26257                                  ;
 26258                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26259                                  ;

 26261                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26262                                  
 26263                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:

 26273 00001C3A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26274 00001C3B 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26275 00001C3C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26276 00001C3D 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26277 00001C3E 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26278 00001C3F 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26279 00001C40 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26280                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 26281                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;

 26284 00001C46 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26285                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26286 00001C48 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26287 00001C4A 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26288 00001C4C 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26289 00001C4D 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26290 00001C4E 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26291 00001C4F 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26292 00001C50 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26293 00001C51 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26294 00001C52 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26295 00001C53 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26296                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26297 00001C55 2E8936[1E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset

 26299                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26300                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset

 26304                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26305 00001C64 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26306 00001C67 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26307 00001C69 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26308 00001C6B 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in

 26310 00001C70 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector

 26315 00001C76 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg

 26879                                  
 26880                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26881                                  
 26882                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26883                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26884                                  
 26885                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26886                                  ;
 26887                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26888                                  ;
 26889                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26890                                  ;
 26891                                  ;   Modification log:
 26892                                  ;
 26893                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26894                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26895                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26896                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26897                                  ;
 26898                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26899                                  ;
 26900                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26901                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26902                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26903                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26904                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26905                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26906                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26907                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26908                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26909                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26910                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26911                                  ;
 26912                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26913                                  
 26914                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26915                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26916                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26917                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26918                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26919                                  
 26920                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26921                                  
 26922                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26923                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26924                                  
 26925                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26926                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26927                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26928                                  
 26929                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26930                                  ;
 26931                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26932                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26933                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26934                                  ;	           line.
 26935                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26936                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26937                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26938                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26939                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26940                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26941                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26942                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26943                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26944                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26945                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26946                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26947                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26948                                  ;	           for details).
 26949                                  
 26950                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26951                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26952                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26953                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26954                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26955                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26956                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26957                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26958                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26959                                  
 26960                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26961                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26962                                  
 26963                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26964                                  
 26965                                  %endif
 26966                                  
 26967                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26968                                  
 26969                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 26970                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 26971                                  
 26972                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26973                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 26974                                  
 26975                                  		;public	DevEntry
 26976                                  
 26977 00001E60 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26978 00001E62 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26979 00001E64 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26980 00001E66 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26981 00001E6A 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26982                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26983                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26984                                  ;
 26985 00001E6E 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 26986 00001E6F 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26987 00001E71 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26988 00001E73 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 26989                                  ;
 26990 00001E75 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 26991                                  ;
 26992 00001E79 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 26993 00001E7B 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 26994                                  ;
 26995 00001E7D 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 26996                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 26997 00001E7E 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 26998                                  ;
 26999 00001E80 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 27000 00001E81 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 27001 00001E83 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 27002                                  ;

 27216                                  
 27217 00001F57 C606[0D14]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27218 00001F5C C606[1014]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.

 27220 00001F63 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 27221                                  
 27222                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27223                                  %if 0
 27224                                  
 27225                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27226                                  
 27227                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27228                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27229                                  
 27230                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27231                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27232                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27233                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27234                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27235                                  
 27236                                          push    ax                      ;
 27237                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27238                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27239                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27240                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27241                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27242                                          pop     ax
 27243                                  ;
 27244                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27245                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27246                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27247                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27248                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27249                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27250                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27251                                  ;   spot.
 27252                                  ;
 27253                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27254                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27255                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27256                                  ;   retrieved.
 27257                                  ;
 27258                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27259                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 27260                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27261                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27262                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27263                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27264                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 27265                                  final:                                  ;
 27266                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27267                                  not_final:                              ;
 27268                                  ;endif
 27269                                  
 27270                                  %endif
 27271 00001F65 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27272 00001F67 E87410                  	call	getchr
 27273 00001F6A 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27274

 27279 00001F73 E9FB06                  	jmp	badop
 27280

 27294                                  ; 11/12/2022

 27297                                  	;push	cs

 27301                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27302                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27303                                  ;install= command.

 27306                                  ;install command

 27309                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27310                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 27311                                  tryi:
 27312 00001F80 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 27313 00001F85 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 27314 00001F87 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 27315                                  not_init_pass:
 27316 00001F8A 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 27317                                          ; 11/12/2022
 27318                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 27319 00001F8F 74E5                    	je	short coff
 27320                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27321                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27322                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 27323                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 27324                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 27325                                  					; and before install= commands
 27326                                  					; are processed
 27327                                  
 27328 00001F91 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 27329 00001F96 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 27330 00001F98 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 27331                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27332                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 27333 00001F9B 74D9                    	je	short coff
 27334                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27335                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27336                                  
 27337                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 27338                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 27339                                          
 27340 00001F9D 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 27341                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 27342                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27343 00001FA0 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 27344                                  	
 27345                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 27346 00001FA2 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27347                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 27348 00001FA7 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 27349                                  
 27350                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27351                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 27352                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 27353                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 27354                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27355                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27356                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 27357                                  
 27358                                  multi_try_i:
 27359 00001FA9 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 27360                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 27361                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27362 00001FAC 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 27363                                  
 27364                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27365                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27366                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27367                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27368                                  ;;endif
 27369                                  
 27370 00001FAE E873F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 27371 00001FB1 EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 27372                                  
 27373                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27374                                  %if 0
 27375                                  
 27376                                  multi_try_n:
 27377                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 27378                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 27379                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27380                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27381                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27382                                  ;endif
 27383                                  
 27384                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 27385                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 27386                                  
 27387                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 27388                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 27389                                  	mov	bx,ax
 27390                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 27391                                  
 27392                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 27393                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 27394                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 27395                                  
 27396                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 27397                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 27398                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 27399                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 27400                                  
 27401                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 27402                                  	mov	bx,1
 27403                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 27404                                  
 27405                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 27406                                  
 27407                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 27408                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 27409                                          int     21h
 27410                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 27411                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 27412                                          int     21h
 27413                                  
 27414                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 27415                                  
 27416                                  %endif
 27417                                  
 27418                                  multi_pass_filter:
 27419 00001FB3 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 27420 00001FB6 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 27421 00001FB8 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 27422 00001FBB 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 27423 00001FBD 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 27424 00001FC0 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 27425                                  
 27426                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 27427 00001FC2 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 27428 00001FC6 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 27429                                  
 27430                                  multi_pass_coff:
 27431                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27432 00001FCA EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 27433                                  
 27434                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27435                                  ; buffer command
 27436                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27437                                  
 27438                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27439                                  ;									      *
 27440                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27441                                  ;									      *
 27442                                  ; input :								      *
 27443                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27444                                  ; output:								      *
 27445                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27446                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27447                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27448                                  ;									      *
 27449                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27450                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27451                                  ; logic:								      *
 27452                                  ; {									      *
 27453                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27454                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27455                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27456                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27457                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27458                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27459                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27460                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27461                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27462                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27463                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27464                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27465                                  ;	};								      *
 27466                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27467                                  ; };									      *
 27468                                  ;									      *
 27469                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27470                                  
 27471                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27472                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27473                                  tryb:
 27474 00001FCC 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27475 00001FCF 7557                    	jne	short tryc

 27559                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27560                                  
 27561                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27562                                  ;									    *
 27563                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27564                                  ;									    *
 27565                                  ; input :								    *
 27566                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27567                                  ; output:								    *
 27568                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *

 27578                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27579                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *

 27581                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27582                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *

 28984                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28985                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28986                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28987                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28988                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28989                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28990                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28991                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28992                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28993                                  
 28994                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28995                                  ;									  *
 28996                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28997                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28998                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28999                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29000                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29001                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29002                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29003                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29004                                  ; input :								  *
 29005                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29006                                  ; output:								  *
 29007                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29008                                  ;									  *
 29009                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29010                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29011                                  ; logic:								  *
 29012                                  ; {									  *
 29013                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29014                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29015                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29016                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29017                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29018                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29019                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29020                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29021                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29022                                  ;	     }								  *
 29023                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29024                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29025                                  ;	};								  *
 29026                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29027                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29028                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29029                                  ; };									  *
 29030                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29031

 29466                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 29467                                  ;								       *
 29468                                  ; input :							       *
 29469                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *

 29472                                  ;								       *

 29700                                  
 29701                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29702                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29703                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 29704                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29705                                  ;
 29706                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29707                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29708                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29709                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29710                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29711                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29712                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29713                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29714                                  ;	 procedure.
 29715                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29716                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29717                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29718                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 29719                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer

 30061                                  ;
 30062                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30063                                  ;
 30064                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30065                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30066                                  ;
 30067                                  ;	Output : none
 30068                                  ;
 30069                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30070                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30071                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30072                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30073                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30074                                  ;
 30075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30076

 30078                                  	; 11/12/2022

 30082                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30083 000026FA E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30084 000026FD 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30085                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30086                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30087                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30088                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 30089                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30090                                  	; ds = cs
 30091 000026FF 803E[7D1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30092 00002704 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30093 00002706 A1[641E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30094                                  lim_set:
 30095                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30096                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30097                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30098                                  ;limx:
 30099                                  	;retn
 30100                                  	
 30101                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 30102                                  
 30103                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30104                                  ;
 30105                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30106                                  ;
 30107                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30108                                  ;	Output : none
 30109                                  ;
 30110                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30111                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30112                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30113                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30114                                  ;
 30115                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30116                                  
 30117                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30118                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30119 00002709 1E                      	push	ds
 30120 0000270A BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30121 0000270D 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30122 0000270F 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30123 00002713 2E891E[811E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30124 00002718 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30125 0000271A D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30126 0000271C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30127 0000271F 2EC606[801E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30128 00002725 1F                      	pop	ds
 30129                                  ;limx:
 30130 00002726 C3                      	retn
 30131                                  
 30132                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30133                                  ;
 30134                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30135                                  ;

 30137                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30138                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30139                                  ;
 30140                                  ;	Output : none
 30141                                  ;

 30143                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30144                                  ;
 30145                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30148                                  	; 11/12/2022

 30153                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30154 0000272C 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30155                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30156 0000272E B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30157 00002731 8826[801E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30158                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30159                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30160 00002735 1E                      	push	ds
 30161                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30162 00002736 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30163 00002738 2EA1[811E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]

 30165 0000273F 1F                      	pop	ds
 30166                                  timx:
 30167 00002740 C3                      	retn

 30216                                  
 30217                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30218                                  
 30219                                  %if 0
 30220                                  
 30221                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30222                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30223                                  
 30224                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30225                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30226                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30227                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30228                                  
 30229                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30230                                  ;
 30231                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30232                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30233                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30234                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30235                                  ;
 30236                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30237                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30238                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30239                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30240                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30241                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30242                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30243                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30244                                  ; available during the load.
 30245                                  ;
 30246                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30247                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30248                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30249                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30250                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30251                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30252                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30253                                  ;
 30254                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30255                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30256                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30257                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30258                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30259                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30260                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30261                                  ;
 30262                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30263                                  
 30264                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30265                                  
 30266                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30267                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30268                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30269                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30270                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30271                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30272                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30273                                  
 30274                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30275                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30276                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30277                                  
 30278                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30279                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30280                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30281                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30282                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30283                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30284                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30285                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30286                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 30287                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30288                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30289                                  
 30290                                  InitVar:
 30291                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30292                                  	push	ax
 30293                                  	push	cx
 30294                                  	push	di
 30295                                  	push	es
 30296                                  
 30297                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30298                                  	push	cs
 30299                                  	pop	es
 30300                                  
 30301                                  	xor	ax,ax
 30302                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30303                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30304                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30305                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30306                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30307                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30308                                  
 30309                                  	cld
 30310                                  
 30311                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30312                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30313                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30314                                  
 30315                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30316                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30317                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30318                                  
 30319                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30320                                  
 30321                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30322                                  	pop	es
 30323                                  	pop	di
 30324                                  	pop	cx
 30325                                  	pop	ax	 	
 30326                                  
 30327                                  	retn
 30328                                  
 30329                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30330                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30331                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30332                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30333                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30334                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30335                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30336                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30337                                  
 30338                                  FixMem:
 30339                                  	push	ax
 30340                                  	push	bx
 30341                                  	push	cx
 30342                                  	push	dx
 30343                                  	push	es
 30344                                  
 30345                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30346                                  
 30347                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30348                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30349                                  
 30350                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30351                                  
 30352                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30353                                  
 30354                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30355                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30356                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30357                                  
 30358                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30359                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30360                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30361                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30362                                  
 30363                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30364                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30365                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30366                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30367                                  
 30368                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30369                                  
 30370                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30371                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30372                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30373                                  
 30374                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30375                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30376                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30377                                  	inc	bx
 30378                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30379                                  
 30380                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30381                                  
 30382                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30383                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30384                                  
 30385                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30386                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30387                                  	inc	bx
 30388                                  	mov	es,bx
 30389                                  
 30390                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30391                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30392                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30393                                  fmX:	
 30394                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30395                                  
 30396                                  	pop	es
 30397                                  	pop	dx
 30398                                  	pop	cx
 30399                                  	pop	bx
 30400                                  	pop	ax
 30401                                  
 30402                                  	retn
 30403                                  
 30404                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30405                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30406                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30407                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30408                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30409                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30410                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30411                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30412                                  
 30413                                  fm_link:
 30414                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30415                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30416                                  
 30417                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30418                                  	;
 30419                                  	;push	es
 30420                                  	;push	cs
 30421                                  	;pop	es
 30422                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30423                                  	;pop	es
 30424                                  	
 30425                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30426                                  
 30427                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30428                                  	mov	bx,1
 30429                                  	int	21h
 30430                                  	retn
 30431                                  
 30432                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30433                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30434                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30435                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30436                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30437                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30438                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30439                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30440                                  
 30441                                  fm_unlink:
 30442                                  	xor	bx,bx
 30443                                  	
 30444                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30445                                  	;
 30446                                  	;push	ds
 30447                                  	;push	cs
 30448                                  	;pop	ds
 30449                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30450                                  	;pop	ds
 30451                                  	
 30452                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30453                                  
 30454                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30455                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30456                                  	retn
 30457                                  
 30458                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30459                                  
 30460                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30461                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30462                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30463                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30464                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30465                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30466                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30467                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30468                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30469                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30470                                  ;
 30471                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30472                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30473                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30474                                  ;
 30475                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30476                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30477                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30478                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30479                                  ;
 30480                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30481                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30482                                  ;
 30483                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30484                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30485                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30486                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30487                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30488                                  ;     lh
 30489                                  ;     /l
 30490                                  ;     1
 30491                                  ;     1000
 30492                                  ;     2
 30493                                  ;     print
 30494                                  ;     /d
 30495                                  ;     :lpt2
 30496                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30497                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30498                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30499                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30500                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30501                                  ; for:
 30502                                  ;    Each /L
 30503                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30504                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30505                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30506                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30507                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30508                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30509                                  
 30510                                  ParseVar:
 30511                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30512                                  	push	di
 30513                                  	push	ds
 30514                                  	push	es
 30515                                  
 30516                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30517                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30518                                  	cld
 30519                                  
 30520                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30521                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30522                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30523                                  
 30524                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30525                                  	call	isWhite
 30526                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30527                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30528                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30529                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30530                                  
 30531                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30532                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30533                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30534                                  
 30535                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30536                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30537                                  	and	al,0DFh
 30538                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30539                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30540                                  	jne	short pv30
 30541                                  
 30542                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30543                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30544                                  
 30545                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30546                                  	;
 30547                                  	;push	es
 30548                                  	;push	cs
 30549                                  	;pop	es
 30550                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30551                                  	;pop	es
 30552                                  
 30553                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30554                                  
 30555                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30556                                  
 30557                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30558                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30559                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30560                                  
 30561                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30562                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30563                                  
 30564                                  	call	parseL
 30565                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30566                                  
 30567                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30568                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30569                                  
 30570                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30571                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30572                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 30573                                  	dec	si
 30574                                  	stc
 30575                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30576                                  	pop	es
 30577                                  	pop	ds
 30578                                  	pop	di
 30579                                  	retn
 30580                                  
 30581                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30582                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30583                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30584                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30585                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30586                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30587                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30588                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30589                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30590                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30591                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 30592                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30593                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30594                                  
 30595                                  parseL:
 30596                                  	lodsb
 30597                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30598                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30599                                  
 30600                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30601                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30602                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30603                                  
 30604                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30605                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30606                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30607                                  
 30608                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30609                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30610                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30611                                  
 30612                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30613                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30614                                  
 30615                                  	lodsb
 30616                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30617                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30618                                  
 30619                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30620                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30621                                  
 30622                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30623                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30624
