 35527                                  
 35528                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 35529                                  
 35530                                  menu_getdefault:
 35531                                          or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 35532                                          jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 35533                                          sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 35534                                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 35535                                  menu_valid:
 35536                                          sub     bx,bx           ;
 35537                                          mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 35538                                          mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 35539                                          or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 35540                                          jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 35541                                          inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 35542                                  menu_chkdefault:
 35543                                          push    bx              ;
 35544                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 35545                                          mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 35546                                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 35547                                          push    ds              ;
 35548                                          push    es              ;
 35549                                          pop     ds              ;
 35550                                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 35551                                          pop     ds              ;
 35552                                          pop     bx              ;
 35553                                          je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 35554                                          inc     bx              ;
 35555                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 35556                                          jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 35557                                  menu_nodefault:
 35558                                          mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 35559                                  menu_setdefault:
 35560                                          mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 35561                                  
 35562                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 35563                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 35564                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 35565                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 35566                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 35567                                  ;   with no timeout)
 35568                                  
 35569                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 35570                                          jne	short menu_display ; no
 35571                                          test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 35572                                          jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 35573                                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 35574                                  
 35575                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 35576                                  
 35577                                  menu_display:
 35578                                          mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 35579                                          int     10h             ;
 35580                                          mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 35581                                          int     10h             ;
 35582                                          push    es              ;
 35583                                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 35584                                          mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 35585                                          mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 35586                                          mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 35587                                          mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 35588                                          mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 35589                                          mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 35590                                          int     10h             ;
 35591                                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 35592                                          mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 35593                                          sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 35594                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 35595                                          mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 35596                                  	dec     dl              ;
 35597                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 35598                                          mov	dh,[es:84h]
 35599                                  	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 35600                                          jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 35601                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 35602                                  menu_clear:
 35603                                          int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 35604                                          pop     es              ;
 35605                                          mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 35606                                          mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 35607                                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 35608                                  
 35609                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 35610                                          jnz     short menu_nostatus
 35611                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 35612                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 35613                                          mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 35614                                          mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 35615                                          int     10h             ;
 35616                                          mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 35617                                          call    print           ;
 35618                                          mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 35619                                          int     10h             ;
 35620                                          sub     dl,2            ;
 35621                                          mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 35622                                  
 35623                                  menu_nostatus:
 35624                                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 35625                                  menu_disploop:
 35626                                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 35627                                          inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"?  because it's a 1-byte opcode
 35628                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 35629                                          jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 35630                                  
 35631                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 35632                                  
 35633                                          mov     dl,0            ; select column
 35634                                          mov     dh,bl           ;
 35635                                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 35636                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 35637                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 35638                                          int     10h             ;
 35639                                  
 35640                                          mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 35641                                          call    print           ;
 35642                                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 35643                                          mov     dx,crlfm	
 35644                                          call    print           ;
 35645                                          push    word [bDisableUI]
 35646                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 35647                                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 35648                                          pop     word [bDisableUI]
 35649                                  
 35650                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 35651                                  
 35652                                  menu_autoselect:
 35653                                          cmp     bx,-1           ; clean boot requested?
 35654                                          jne	short normal_boot ; no
 35655                                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 35656                                  menu_abort:
 35657                                          sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 35658                                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 35659                                  
 35660                                  normal_boot:
 35661                                          cmp     bx,-2           ; back to top-level menu?
 35662                                          jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 35663                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 35664                                          sub     si,si           ;
 35665                                          jmp     menu_search
 35666                                  
 35667                                  not_topmenu:
 35668                                          cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 35669                                          jne	short not_submenu
 35670                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 35671                                          mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 35672                                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 35673                                          mov     si,di           ;
 35674                                          mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 35675                                          jmp     menu_found
 35676                                  
 35677                                  not_submenu:
 35678                                          add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 35679                                          mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 35680                                  
 35681                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 35682                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 35683                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 35684                                  
 35685                                  no_selection:
 35686                                          mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 35687                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 35688                                          sub     si,si           ;
 35689                                          push    ds              ;
 35690                                          mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 35691                                          sub     di,di           ;
 35692                                  
 35693                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 35694                                  ;
 35695                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 35696                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 35697                                  ;   within the requested block.  Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 35698                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion;  the amount of recursion is
 35699                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 35700                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 35701                                  ;
 35702                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 35703                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 35704                                  
 35705                                  copyblock_loop:
 35706                                          push    bx              ; save selected block name
 35707                                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 35708                                          pop     bx              ;
 35709                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 35710                                  
 35711                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons:  it hit eof or a new block
 35712                                  
 35713                                  copyblock_begin:
 35714                                          push    ax              ;
 35715                                          push    cx              ;
 35716                                          push    si              ;
 35717                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 35718                                          mov     di,szCommon
 35719                                          push    ds              ;
 35720                                          push    cs              ;
 35721                                          pop     ds              ;
 35722                                          call    comp_names      ;
 35723                                          pop     ds              ;
 35724                                          pop     di              ;
 35725                                          pop     si              ;
 35726                                          pop     cx              ;
 35727                                          pop     ax              ;
 35728                                          je	short copyblock_check
 35729                                          or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 35730                                          jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 35731                                          push    di              ;
 35732                                          mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 35733                                          push    ds              ;
 35734                                          push    es              ;
 35735                                          pop     ds              ;
 35736                                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 35737                                          pop     ds              ;
 35738                                          pop     di              ;
 35739                                  copyblock_check:
 35740                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 35741                                          jne	short copyblock_skip  ;
 35742                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 35743                                          jmp	short copyblock_loop 
 35744                                  
 35745                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 35746                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 35747                                          call    get_char        ;
 35748                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 35749                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 35750                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 35751                                          je	short copyblock_begin
 35752                                          jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 35753                                  ;
 35754                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 35755                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 35756                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 35757                                  ;
 35758                                  move_config:
 35759                                          mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 35760                                          push    cx              ;
 35761                                  ;
 35762                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 35763                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 35764                                  ;
 35765                                   	;mov	cx,7
 35766                                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 35767                                          mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 35768                                          inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 35769                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 35770                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 35771                                  copy_boot: 
 35772                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 35773                                          cs
 35774                                  	lodsb
 35775                                  	mov     [di],al         ;
 35776                                          inc     di              ;
 35777                                          loop    copy_boot       ;
 35778                                  
 35779                                          push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 35780                                          mov     cx,128-7        ; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 35781                                          mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
 35782                                          or      si,si           ; valid?
 35783                                          jnz	short l1	; yes
 35784                                          push    cs              ;
 35785                                          pop     es              ;
 35786                                          mov     si,szCommon
 35787                                  l1:     mov     al,[es:si]      ;
 35788                                          call    any_delim       ;
 35789                                          je	short l2	;
 35790                                          mov     [di],al         ;
 35791                                          inc     si              ;
 35792                                          inc     di              ;
 35793                                          loop    l1              ;
 35794                                  l2:     mov     byte [di],lf	; terminate the configuration string
 35795                                          pop     es              ;
 35796                                  
 35797                                  ;   Now we can copy "config_wrkseg" (DS) to "confbot" (ES)
 35798                                  
 35799                                          sub     di,di           ;
 35800                                          mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 35801                                          sub     si,si           ;
 35802                                          pop     cx              ; recover the size of "config_wrkseg"
 35803                                  
 35804                                          push    cx              ;
 35805                                          rep     movsb           ; moved!
 35806                                          pop     cx              ;
 35807                                          mov     ax,ds           ;
 35808                                          pop     ds              ;
 35809                                  
 35810                                  ;   Now that the config_wrkseg is available once again, we shall
 35811                                  ;   use it to create an environment. The first thing to go in will be
 35812                                  ;   the "CONFIG=configuration" thing. It is also important to zero
 35813                                  ;   the first byte of the workspace, so that copy_envvar knows the buffer
 35814                                  ;   is empty.
 35815                                  
 35816                                          push    es              ;
 35817                                          mov     es,ax           ;
 35818                                          inc     si              ; ES:SI -> "CONFIG=configuration"
 35819                                          mov     byte [es:0],0	;empty the environment block
 35820                                          call    copy_envvar     ; copy envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 35821                                          pop     es
 35822                                  
 35823                                  ;   Before returning, restore the default video page setting but do NOT
 35824                                  ;   do it using INT 10h's Set Active Page function, because if the menu was
 35825                                  ;   displayed on a different page, then it's because we don't want to see
 35826                                  ;   all the device driver/TSR goop (which goes to the default page)
 35827                                  
 35828                                  menu_done:
 35829                                          cmp     byte [bMenuPage],0
 35830                                          je	short menu_exit	;
 35831                                          push    es              ;
 35832                                          mov     ax,40h          ;
 35833                                          mov     es,ax           ;
 35834                                          mov     ax,[wCRTStart]  ;
 35835                                          mov     [es:004Eh],ax   ;
 35836                                          mov     al,[bCRTPage]   ;
 35837                                          mov     [es:0062h],al   ;
 35838                                          pop     es              ;
 35839                                  menu_exit:
 35840                                          mov     [count],cx      ; set new counts
 35841                                          mov     [org_count],cx  ;
 35842                                          sub     si,si           ; always return ES:SI pointing to config.sys
 35843                                          retn
 35844                                  
 35845                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35846                                  ;
 35847                                  ;   copy_envvar:  copy the envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 35848                                  ;
 35849                                  ;   INPUT
 35850                                  ;    ES:SI -> environment variable (in the form "var=string<cr/lf>")
 35851                                  ;
 35852                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35853                                  ;       config_envlen (ie, where to put next envvar) updated appropriately
 35854                                  ;       carry set if error (eg, missing =); clear otherwise
 35855                                  ;
 35856                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35857                                  ;       None
 35858                                  ;
 35859                                  ;   NOTES
 35860                                  ;       None
 35861                                  ;
 35862                                  ;   HISTORY
 35863                                  ;       Created 29-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35864                                  ;
 35865                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35866                                  
 35867                                  copy_envvar:
 35868                                          push    cx              ;
 35869                                          push    si              ;
 35870                                          push    ds              ;
 35871                                          push    es              ;
 35872                                          push    es              ;
 35873                                          mov     es,[config_wrkseg] ; ES:DI to point to next available byte
 35874                                          pop     ds                 ; DS:SI to point to envvar
 35875                                  
 35876                                  ;   Have to calculate the length of the variable name (and if we hit
 35877                                  ;   the end of the line before we hit '=', then it's curtains for this
 35878                                  ;   config.sys line)
 35879                                  ;
 35880                                  ;   The check for NULL is important because copy_envvar is also used to copy
 35881                                  ;   the initial CONFIG= setting, which will have been zapped by a NULL if no
 35882                                  ;   menu block existed (in order to prevent the creation of an environment)
 35883                                  
 35884                                          sub     cx,cx           ;
 35885                                  copy_varlen:                    ;
 35886                                          lodsb                   ;
 35887                                          or      al,al           ; NULL?
 35888                                          stc                     ;
 35889                                          jz	short copy_envexit ; yes, abort
 35890                                          cmp     al,cr          ;
 35891                                          stc                     ;
 35892                                          je	short copy_envexit
 35893                                          cmp     al,lf          ;
 35894                                          stc                     ;
 35895                                          je	short copy_envexit
 35896                                          inc     cx              ;
 35897                                          cmp     al,'='          ;
 35898                                          jne	short copy_varlen
 35899                                          mov     al,0            ;
 35900                                          mov     ah,[si]         ; save char after '='
 35901                                          sub     si,cx           ; back up to given varname
 35902                                          dec     cx              ; CX == # of bytes in varname
 35903                                          sub     di,di           ; start looking for DS:SI at ES:0
 35904                                  copy_varsrch:
 35905                                          cmp     byte [es:di],al
 35906                                          je	short copy_envprep ; search failed, just copy var
 35907                                          mov     bx,di           ; ES:BX -> start of this varname
 35908                                          push    cx              ;
 35909                                          push    si              ;
 35910                                          repe    cmpsb           ;
 35911                                          pop     si              ;
 35912                                          pop     cx              ;
 35913                                          jne	short copy_varnext ; no match, skip to next varname
 35914                                          cmp     byte [es:di],'='
 35915                                          jne     short copy_varnext ; no match, there's more characters
 35916                                  
 35917                                  ;   Previous occurrence of variable has been found; determine the
 35918                                  ;   entire length and then destroy it
 35919                                  
 35920                                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 35921                                          repne   scasb           ; guaranteed to get null (since we put it there)
 35922                                          push    si              ;
 35923                                          mov     si,di           ;
 35924                                          mov     di,bx           ;
 35925                                          mov     cx,[cs:config_envlen]
 35926                                          sub     cx,si           ; destroy variable now
 35927                                  	;rep movs byte ptr es:[di],byte ptr es:[si]
 35928                                  	;;db 0F3h,26h,0A4h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4724h
 35929                                  
 35930                                  	rep	; 0F3h
 35931                                  	es	; 26h
 35932                                  	movsb	; 0A4h
 35933                                  
 35934                                  	pop     si
 35935                                  copy_envprep:
 35936                                          cmp     ah,cr          ; if there is nothing after the '='
 35937                                          je	short copy_envdel ; then just exit with variable deleted
 35938                                          cmp     ah,lf           ;
 35939                                          je	short copy_envdel
 35940                                          jmp     short copy_envloop
 35941                                  
 35942                                  copy_varnext:                   ;
 35943                                          push    cx              ;
 35944                                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 35945                                          repne   scasb           ;
 35946                                          pop     cx              ;
 35947                                          jmp	short copy_varsrch
 35948                                  
 35949                                  copy_envloop:                   ;
 35950                                          lodsb                   ;
 35951                                          cmp     al,cr           ;
 35952                                          je	short copy_envdone
 35953                                          cmp     al,lf           ;
 35954                                          je	short copy_envdone
 35955                                          stosb                   ;
 35956                                          jmp     short copy_envloop
 35957                                  
 35958                                  copy_envdone:                   ;
 35959                                          sub     al,al           ; do SUB to clear carry as well
 35960                                          stosb                   ; always null-terminate these puppies
 35961                                  copy_envdel:                    ;
 35962                                          mov     [es:di],al      ; and stick another null to terminate the env.
 35963                                          mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 35964                                  
 35965                                  copy_envexit:                   ;
 35966                                          pop     es              ;
 35967                                          pop     ds              ;
 35968                                          pop     si              ;
 35969                                          pop     cx              ;
 35970                                  
 35971                                  copy_done:	; 18/12/2022
 35972                                          retn
 35973                                  
 35974                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35975                                  ;
 35976                                  ;   copy_block:  copy the current block to the new config.sys workspace
 35977                                  ;
 35978                                  ;   INPUT
 35979                                  ;       CX == remaining bytes in "organized" config.sys memory image
 35980                                  ;    ES:SI -> remaining bytes in "organized" config.sys memory image
 35981                                  ;    DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace (equal in size to the original
 35982                                  ;             config.sys image) where the current block is to be copied
 35983                                  ;
 35984                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35985                                  ;       Same as above
 35986                                  ;       AL also equals the last character read from the organized image
 35987                                  ;
 35988                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35989                                  ;       All
 35990                                  ;
 35991                                  ;   NOTES
 35992                                  ;       None
 35993                                  ;
 35994                                  ;   HISTORY
 35995                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35996                                  ;
 35997                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35998                                  
 35999                                  copy_block:
 36000                                          call    get_char        ; check for include
 36001                                          jc	short copy_done	;
 36002                                  	and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 36003                                  	cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; another BEGIN implies END as well
 36004                                          je	short copy_done ;
 36005                                  
 36006                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_INCLUDE ; 'J'
 36007                                          mov     al,ah           ; AL == the original line code
 36008                                          jne	short copy_line	; not an "include" line
 36009                                  
 36010                                  ;   We have hit an "INCLUDE" line; first, REM out the line so that we
 36011                                  ;   never try to include the block again (no infinite include loops please),
 36012                                  ;   then search for the named block and call copy_block again.
 36013                                  
 36014                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM ; '0'
 36015                                          push    di              ;
 36016                                  
 36017                                          mov     di,szMenu
 36018                                          call    comp_names_safe ; don't allow INCLUDE MENU
 36019                                          je	short copy_skip	;
 36020                                  
 36021                                          mov     di,szCommon
 36022                                          call    comp_names_safe ; don't allow INCLUDE COMMON
 36023                                          je	short copy_skip	;
 36024                                  
 36025                                          mov     di,si           ; try to find the block
 36026                                          call    srch_block      ;
 36027                                          mov     dx,di           ;
 36028                                          pop     di              ;
 36029                                          jne	short copy_error ; no such block
 36030                                          push    cx              ;
 36031                                          mov     cx,bx           ;
 36032                                          push    si              ;
 36033                                          dec     dx              ;
 36034                                          mov     si,dx           ;
 36035                                          call    skip_line       ; skip the rest of the "block name" line
 36036                                          call    copy_block      ; and copy in the rest of that block
 36037                                          pop     si              ;
 36038                                          pop     cx              ;
 36039                                          sub     al,al           ; force skip_opt_line to skip...
 36040                                          jmp     short copy_nextline
 36041                                  
 36042                                  copy_skip:
 36043                                          pop     di
 36044                                  copy_error:
 36045                                          clc                     ;
 36046                                          call    print_error     ; note that carry is clear, no pause
 36047                                          jmp     short copy_nextline
 36048                                  
 36049                                  ;   Copy the line at ES:SI to the current location at DS:DI
 36050                                  
 36051                                  copy_line:
 36052                                          mov     [di],al         ;
 36053                                          inc     di              ;
 36054                                          cmp     al,' '          ; is this is a "real" line with a "real" code?
 36055                                          jb	short copy_nextline ; no
 36056                                          cmp     byte [cs:config_multi],0
 36057                                          je	short copy_loop	; not a multi-config config.sys, don't embed #s
 36058                                          call    get_linenum	; BX == line # of line @ES:SI
 36059                                          mov     [di],bx         ; stash it immediately following the line code
 36060                                          inc     di              ;
 36061                                          inc     di              ;
 36062                                          jmp     short copy_next ;
 36063                                  copy_loop:                      ;
 36064                                          call    get_char        ;
 36065                                          jc	short copy_done ; end of file
 36066                                          mov     [di],al         ;
 36067                                          inc     di              ;
 36068                                  copy_next:
 36069                                          cmp     al,lf ; 0Ah	; done with line?
 36070                                          jne	short copy_loop	; nope
 36071                                  
 36072                                  copy_nextline:
 36073                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 36074                                          jmp     short copy_block
 36075                                  
 36076                                  	; 18/12/2022
 36077                                  ;copy_done:
 36078                                          ;retn
 36079                                  
 36080                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36081                                  ;
 36082                                  ;   get_linenum:  return line # (in BX) of current line (@ES:SI)
 36083                                  ;
 36084                                  ;   INPUT
 36085                                  ;    ES:SI -> some line in the config.sys memory image
 36086                                  ;
 36087                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36088                                  ;       BX == line # (relative to 1)
 36089                                  ;
 36090                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36091                                  ;       DX
 36092                                  ;
 36093                                  ;   NOTES
 36094                                  ;       None
 36095                                  ;
 36096                                  ;   HISTORY
 36097                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36098                                  ;
 36099                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36100                                  
 36101                                  get_linenum:
 36102                                          push    ax              ;
 36103                                          sub     bx,bx           ; BX == line # (to be returned)
 36104                                          push    cx              ;
 36105                                          mov     dx,si           ; DX == the offset we're looking for
 36106                                          push    si              ;
 36107                                          mov     cx,[cs:count]   ;
 36108                                          sub     si,si           ; prepare to scan entire file
 36109                                  get_linenum_loop:               ;
 36110                                          call    skip_line       ;
 36111                                          jc	short get_linenum_done
 36112                                          inc     bx              ;
 36113                                          cmp     si,dx           ; have we exceeded the desired offset yet?
 36114                                          jb	short get_linenum_loop ; no
 36115                                  get_linenum_done:               ;
 36116                                          pop     si              ;
 36117                                          pop     cx              ;
 36118                                          pop     ax              ;
 36119                                          retn
 36120                                  
 36121                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36122                                  ;
 36123                                  ;   srch_block:  searches entire config.sys for block name @ES:DI
 36124                                  ;
 36125                                  ;   INPUT
 36126                                  ;       ES -> config.sys image
 36127                                  ;    ES:DI -> block name to find
 36128                                  ;
 36129                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36130                                  ;       ZF flag set, if found
 36131                                  ;    ES:DI -> just past the name in the block heading, if found
 36132                                  ;       BX == # bytes remaining from that point, if found
 36133                                  ;
 36134                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36135                                  ;       None
 36136                                  ;
 36137                                  ;   NOTES
 36138                                  ;       This differs from "find_block" in that it searches the ENTIRE
 36139                                  ;       config.sys image, not merely the remaining portion, and that it
 36140                                  ;       takes a pointer to block name that is *elsewhere* in the image
 36141                                  ;       (ie, ES) as opposed to some string constant in our own segment (DS).
 36142                                  ;
 36143                                  ;   HISTORY
 36144                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36145                                  ;
 36146                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36147                                  
 36148                                  srch_block:	          ; returns BX -> named block in CONFIG.SYS
 36149                                          push    ax              ;
 36150                                          push    cx              ;
 36151                                          mov     cx,[cs:count]   ;
 36152                                          push    si              ;
 36153                                          sub     si,si           ;
 36154                                          push    ds              ;
 36155                                          push    es              ;
 36156                                          pop     ds              ;
 36157                                          call    find_block      ;
 36158                                          mov     di,si           ;
 36159                                          mov     bx,cx           ;
 36160                                          pop     ds              ;
 36161                                          pop     si              ;
 36162                                          pop     cx              ;
 36163                                          pop     ax              ;
 36164                                  find_exit: ; 16/04/2019
 36165                                          retn			;
 36166                                  
 36167                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36168                                  ;
 36169                                  ;   find_block:  searches rest of config.sys for block name @DS:DI
 36170                                  ;
 36171                                  ;   INPUT
 36172                                  ;    DS:DI -> block name to find
 36173                                  ;    ES:SI -> remainder of config.sys image
 36174                                  ;       CX == remaining size of config.sys image
 36175                                  ;
 36176                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36177                                  ;       ZF flag set, if found (also, CF set if EOF)
 36178                                  ;    ES:SI -> where the search stopped (at end of block name or EOF)
 36179                                  ;       CX == # bytes remaining from that point
 36180                                  ;
 36181                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36182                                  ;       AX
 36183                                  ;
 36184                                  ;   NOTES
 36185                                  ;       This differs from "srch_block" in that it searches only the
 36186                                  ;       remaining portion of the config.sys image and leaves SI and CX
 36187                                  ;       pointing to where the search left off, and that it takes a pointer
 36188                                  ;       to search string in our own segment (DS:DI instead of ES:DI).
 36189                                  ;
 36190                                  ;   HISTORY
 36191                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36192                                  ;
 36193                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36194                                  
 36195                                  find_block:
 36196                                          call    get_char        ; get line code
 36197                                          jc	short find_exit	; end of file
 36198                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 36199                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; beginning of a block?
 36200                                          je	short check_line ; no
 36201                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_INCLUDE
 36202                                          jne	short next_line	;
 36203                                          or	byte [cs:config_multi],1
 36204                                          jmp     short next_line ;
 36205                                  check_line:
 36206                                          or      byte [cs:config_multi],1
 36207                                          call    comp_names      ; compare block names
 36208                                          jbe	short find_exit	; end of file, or names matched
 36209                                  next_line:
 36210                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; no, so skip to next line
 36211                                          jmp	short find_block  ;
 36212                                  ;find_exit:
 36213                                  ;	retn
 36214                                  
 36215                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36216                                  ;
 36217                                  ;   comp_names:  compares keyword @DS:DI to position in config.sys @ES:SI
 36218                                  ;
 36219                                  ;   INPUT
 36220                                  ;    DS:DI -> keyword to compare
 36221                                  ;    ES:SI -> position in config.sys
 36222                                  ;       CX == remaining bytes in config.sys
 36223                                  ;
 36224                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36225                                  ;       ZF flag set, if match (also, CF set if EOF)
 36226                                  ;    ES:SI -> where the comparison stopped (at end of block name or EOF)
 36227                                  ;       CX == # bytes remaining from that point
 36228                                  ;
 36229                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36230                                  ;       AX
 36231                                  ;
 36232                                  ;   NOTES
 36233                                  ;       None
 36234                                  ;
 36235                                  ;   HISTORY
 36236                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36237                                  ;
 36238                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36239                                  
 36240                                  comp_names:
 36241                                          push    di              ;
 36242                                  comp_loop:                      ;
 36243                                          call    get_char        ;
 36244                                          jc	short comp_exit	;
 36245                                          call    any_delim       ; is next character a delimiter?
 36246                                          mov     ah,[di]         ; (get next character we're supposed to match)
 36247                                          je	short comp_almost ; yes, it *could* be a match
 36248                                          inc     di              ;
 36249                                          and     ax,~2020h ; 0DFDFh 
 36250                                  				; BUGBUG -- assumes both names are alphanumeric -JTP
 36251                                          cmp     al,ah           ; match?
 36252                                          je	short comp_loop ; yes, keep looking at the characters
 36253                                          clc                     ; prevent erroneous eof indication: clear carry
 36254                                  comp_exit:                      ;
 36255                                          pop     di              ;
 36256                                          retn			;
 36257                                  comp_almost:                    ;
 36258                                          xchg    al,ah           ; we don't know for sure if it's a match
 36259                                          call    any_delim       ; until we verify that the second string has
 36260                                          xchg    al,ah           ; been exhausted also...
 36261                                          jmp     comp_exit       ; if we are, this call to any_delim will tell...
 36262                                  
 36263                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36264                                  
 36265                                  comp_names_safe:
 36266                                          push    ax
 36267                                          push    cx
 36268                                          push	si
 36269                                          push    ds
 36270                                          push    cs
 36271                                          pop     ds
 36272                                          call    comp_names
 36273                                          pop     ds
 36274                                  	pop	si
 36275                                          pop     cx
 36276                                          pop     ax
 36277                                          retn
 36278                                  
 36279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36280                                  ;
 36281                                  ;   print_item:  display menu item #BL
 36282                                  ;
 36283                                  ;   INPUT
 36284                                  ;       BL == menu item # to display
 36285                                  ;
 36286                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36287                                  ;       Menu item displayed, with appropriate highlighting if BL == bDefBlock
 36288                                  ;
 36289                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36290                                  ;       None
 36291                                  ;
 36292                                  ;   NOTES
 36293                                  ;       This function saves/restores the current cursor position, so you
 36294                                  ;       needn't worry about it.
 36295                                  ;
 36296                                  ;   HISTORY
 36297                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36298                                  ;
 36299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36300                                  
 36301                                  print_item:		; prints menu item #BL (1 to N)
 36302                                          push    ax              ;
 36303                                          push    bx              ;
 36304                                          push    cx              ;
 36305                                          push    dx              ;
 36306                                          push    si              ;
 36307                                          mov     ah,03h          ; get cursor position
 36308                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ; always page zero
 36309                                          int     10h             ; DH/DL = row/column
 36310                                          push    dx              ; save it
 36311                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position
 36312                                          mov     dh,bl           ;
 36313                                          add     dh,3            ;
 36314                                          mov     dl,5            ;
 36315                                          int     10h             ; set cursor position for correct row/col
 36316                                          mov     al,bl           ;
 36317                                          add     al,'0'          ; convert menu item # to ASCII digit
 36318                                          mov     ah,[bMenuColor] ; normal attribute
 36319                                          cmp     bl,[bDefBlock]  ; are we printing the current block?
 36320                                          jne	short print_other ; no
 36321                                          or      ah,70h          ; yes, set bgnd color to white
 36322                                          mov     ch,ah           ;
 36323                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 36324                                          rol     ch,cl           ;
 36325                                          cmp     ch,ah           ; are fgnd/bgnd the same?
 36326                                          jne	short print_other ; no
 36327                                          xor     ah,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 36328                                  print_other:                    ;
 36329                                          mov     bh,0            ;
 36330                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 36331                                          mov     di,[aoffBlockDesc+bx]
 36332                                          mov     bl,ah           ; put the attribute in the correct register now
 36333                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ; get correct video page #
 36334                                          mov     ah,09h          ; write char/attr
 36335                                          mov     cx,1            ;
 36336                                          int     10h             ;
 36337                                          inc     dl              ; increment column
 36338                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36339                                          int     10h             ;
 36340                                          ;mov	ax,0900h+'.'    ;
 36341                                          mov	ax,092Eh
 36342                                  	int     10h             ; display '.'
 36343                                          inc     dl              ; increment column
 36344                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36345                                          int     10h             ;
 36346                                          ;mov	ax,0900h+' '    ;
 36347                                          mov	ax,0920h
 36348                                  	int     10h             ; display ' '
 36349                                          inc     dl              ; increment column
 36350                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36351                                          int     10h             ;
 36352                                          push    es              ;
 36353                                  print_loop:                     ;
 36354                                          mov     al,[es:di]	; get a character of the description
 36355                                          inc     di              ;
 36356                                          cmp     al,TAB ; 9	; substitute spaces for tabs
 36357                                          jne	short print_nontab ;
 36358                                          mov     al,' '          ;
 36359                                  print_nontab:                   ;
 36360                                          cmp     al,' '          ;
 36361                                          jb	short print_done ; stop at the 1st character < space
 36362                                          cmp     al,'$'          ;
 36363                                          je	short print_done ; also stop on $
 36364                                          mov     ah,09h          ; display function #
 36365                                          int     10h             ;
 36366                                          inc     dl              ; increment column
 36367                                          cmp     dl,78           ; far enough?
 36368                                          jae	short print_done ; yes
 36369                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36370                                          int     10h             ;
 36371                                          jmp     print_loop      ;
 36372                                  print_done:                     ;
 36373                                          pop     es              ;
 36374                                          pop     dx              ;
 36375                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36376                                          int     10h             ; restore previous row/col
 36377                                          pop     si              ;
 36378                                          pop     dx              ;
 36379                                          pop     cx              ;
 36380                                          pop     bx              ;
 36381                                          pop     ax              ;
 36382                                          retn			;
 36383                                  
 36384                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36385                                  ;
 36386                                  ;   select_item:  wait for user to select menu item, with time-out
 36387                                  ;
 36388                                  ;   INPUT
 36389                                  ;       None
 36390                                  ;
 36391                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36392                                  ;       BX == menu item # (1-N), or -1 for clean boot
 36393                                  ;       Selected menu item highlighted
 36394                                  ;       Cursor positioned beneath menu, ready for tty-style output now
 36395                                  ;
 36396                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36397                                  ;       None
 36398                                  ;
 36399                                  ;   NOTES
 36400                                  ;       None
 36401                                  ;
 36402                                  ;   HISTORY
 36403                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36404                                  ;
 36405                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36406                                  
 36407                                  select_item:		; returns digit value in BX (trashes AX/CX/DX)
 36408                                          mov     bl,[bDefBlock]  ; BL will be the default block #
 36409                                          mov     al,bl           ;
 36410                                          call    disp_num        ;
 36411                                          call    show_status     ; display current interactive status
 36412                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 36413                                          je	short input_key	; no time-out, just go to input
 36414                                          mov     ah,GET_TIME ; 2Ch
 36415                                          int     21h             ;
 36416                                          mov     bh,dh           ; BH = initial # of seconds
 36417                                  check_time:
 36418                                          mov     al,[secTimeOut] ;
 36419                                          sub     al,[secElapsed] ;
 36420                                          jae	short show_time	;
 36421                                          or      byte [bQueryOpt],2  ; disable all further prompting
 36422                                          mov     byte [secElapsed],0
 36423                                          jmp	select_done	; time's up!
 36424                                  show_time:
 36425                                          push    bx              ;
 36426                                          mov     bl,al           ; save # in BL
 36427                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 36428                                          mov     ah,03h          ; get cursor position
 36429                                          int     10h             ;
 36430                                          push    dx              ;
 36431                                  	add	dl,8		; move cursor to the right
 36432                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position
 36433                                          int     10h             ;
 36434                                          mov     dx,_$TimeOut
 36435                                          call    print           ; print the "Time remaining: " prompt
 36436                                          mov     al,bl           ; recover # from BL
 36437                                          cbw                     ; this works because AL is always <= 90
 36438                                          mov     cl,10           ;
 36439                                          div     cl              ; AL = tens digit, AH = ones digit
 36440                                          mov     cl,ah           ;
 36441                                          add     al,'0'          ;
 36442                                          mov     ah,0Eh          ;
 36443                                          int     10h             ; write TTY tens digit
 36444                                          mov     al,cl           ;
 36445                                          add     al,'0'          ;
 36446                                          mov     ah,0Eh          ;
 36447                                          int     10h             ; write TTY ones digit
 36448                                          pop     dx
 36449                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position back to where it was
 36450                                          int     10h             ;
 36451                                          pop     bx              ;
 36452                                  input_key:
 36453                                          mov     ah,RAW_CON_IO ; 6
 36454                                          mov     dl,0FFh         ; input request
 36455                                          int     21h             ;
 36456                                          jnz	short got_key	;
 36457                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],-1; is there a time-out?
 36458                                          je	short input_key	; no, just go back to input
 36459                                          mov     ah,GET_TIME     ;
 36460                                          int     21h             ; DH = seconds
 36461                                          mov     ah,dh           ;
 36462                                          sub     dh,bh           ; should generally be zero or one
 36463                                          mov     bh,ah           ;
 36464                                          jnc	short got_time	;
 36465                                          mov     dh,1            ; it wrapped back to zero, so assume one
 36466                                  got_time:
 36467                                          or      dh,dh           ; any change?
 36468                                          jz	short input_key	; no
 36469                                          add     [secElapsed],dh ;
 36470                                          jmp	short check_time ;
 36471                                  got_key:
 36472                                          push    ax              ;
 36473                                          mov     ax,-1           ; zap both secTimeOut and secElapsed
 36474                                          xchg    [secTimeOut],ax
 36475                                          cmp     al,-1           ; was time-out already disabled?
 36476                                          je	short timeout_disabled ; yes
 36477                                          push    bx              ; let's disable # seconds display
 36478                                          mov     ax,0A20h        ; write multiple spaces
 36479                                          mov     bx,[bMenuColor]
 36480                                          mov     cx,80           ; 80 of them, to be safe
 36481                                          int     10h             ; to completely obliterate # seconds display
 36482                                          pop     bx   		;
 36483                                  
 36484                                  timeout_disabled:
 36485                                          pop     ax              ;
 36486                                          or      al,al           ; extended key pressed?
 36487                                          jnz	short normal_key ; no
 36488                                          int     21h             ; get the next part of the key then
 36489                                          jz	short input_key	; hmmm, what happened to the second part?
 36490                                  
 36491                                          cmp     al,48h          ; up arrow?
 36492                                          jne	short not_up	; no
 36493                                          cmp     bl,1            ; are we as up as up can get?
 36494                                          jbe	short input_key	; yes, ignore it
 36495                                          dec     byte [bDefBlock] ;
 36496                                          call    print_item      ; re-print the current item
 36497                                          dec     bl              ; and then print the new current item
 36498                                          jmp     short print1
 36499                                  not_up:
 36500                                          cmp     al,50h          ; down arrow?
 36501                                          jne	short not_down	; no
 36502                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; are we as down as down can get?
 36503                                          jae	short to_input_key ; yes, ignore it
 36504                                          inc     byte [bDefBlock] ;
 36505                                          call    print_item      ; re-print the current item
 36506                                          inc     bx              ; and then print the new current item
 36507                                  print1: 
 36508                                  	mov     al,bl           ;
 36509                                  print2: 
 36510                                  	call    print_item      ;
 36511                                          call    disp_num        ;
 36512                                  to_input_key:
 36513                                          jmp     input_key       ;
 36514                                  not_down:
 36515                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 36516                                          jnz	short to_input_key ; don't allow F8 or F5
 36517                                          cmp     al,42h          ; F8 function key?
 36518                                          jne	short not_f8	; no
 36519                                          xor     byte [bQueryOpt],1
 36520                                          call    show_status     ;
 36521                                          jmp     input_key	;
 36522                                  not_f8:
 36523                                          cmp     al,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 36524                                          jne	short to_input_key ; no
 36525                                          mov     bx,-1           ; special return code (-1) indicating clean boot
 36526                                          mov     al,' '          ; don't want to display anything really;
 36527                                          jmp     short disp_input; just want to display the cr/lf sequence...
 36528                                  
 36529                                  normal_key:
 36530                                          cmp     al,0Dh          ; Enter?
 36531                                          je	short select_done ; yes
 36532                                          cmp     al,08h          ; backspace?
 36533                                          jne	short not_backspace ; no
 36534                                          mov     bx,-2 ; 0FFFEh	; yes, special return code
 36535                                          retn			;
 36536                                  not_backspace:
 36537                                          sub     al,'0'          ; is greater than '0'?
 36538                                          jbe	short to_input_key ; no
 36539                                          cmp     al,[bMaxBlock]  ; is less than or equal to the maximum digit?
 36540                                          ja	short to_input_key ; no
 36541                                          mov	[bDefBlock],al  ;
 36542                                          call    print_item      ; redisplay the current selection
 36543                                          mov     bl,al           ; set new selection
 36544                                          jmp	short print2
 36545                                  
 36546                                  select_done:
 36547                                          mov     bh,0            ; return a full 16-bit value (for indexing)
 36548                                          mov     al,bl           ;
 36549                                          add     al,'0'          ; convert it into a digit, then display it
 36550                                  
 36551                                  	; fall into disp_input
 36552                                  
 36553                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36554                                  
 36555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36556                                  ;
 36557                                  ;   disp_input:  display a single character + cr/lf
 36558                                  ;
 36559                                  ;   INPUT
 36560                                  ;       AL == character to display
 36561                                  ;
 36562                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36563                                  ;       None
